  • You want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skills
  • You are a cyber security enthusiast and visionary and are eager to explore how it can be embedded in our future
  • You get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environment
  • You like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others

With the scale and complexity of cyber-attacks increasing every year and the world becoming increasingly more interconnected and technology-enabled, being prepared for the inevitable and able to confidently detect and respond to even the most sophisticated incidents, is no longer an option it’s a necessity. Our team, supports clients across industry verticals enhance their preparedness to deal with the inevitable by expanding their visibility over networks and systems through cutting-edge technology, building and maturing their attack detection capability through tried and tested detection analytics, proactively identifying potential indicators of compromise through threat hunting, and supporting them respond to cyber incidents should the need arise. 


#YourRole

  • Be part of Deloitte’s Cyber Intelligence Center and conduct advanced cyber security analysis to detect adversaries that may have bypassed conventional controls remaining undetected in our clients’ networks and systems.
  • Analyze network and system activity on client systems (during standard business hours only) leveraging technologies such as EDR, XDR and SIEM, to support detection capability development and incident response efforts.
  • Face and solve client cyber threat prevention, detection, and response challenges in an innovative and effective way.
  • Enable clients to respond to cyber incidents swiftly and effectively supporting containment, eradication, remediation and recovery efforts.
  • Receive training and attain certifications in the use of cutting-edge cybersecurity products but also on various cybersecurity topics.
  • Closely collaborate with experts from many different disciplines and geographies.
  • Be part of a global community of Deloitte experts in Cyber Incident Response and Threat Intelligence that provide clients with actionable intelligence to detect and respond against APTs.

#WinningRequirements

  • University degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Cyber Security or equivalent.
  • 1-2 years of experience, preferably in a Cyber Security Analyst or Cyber Security Engineer role will be considered an advantage.
  • Experience with Windows and Unix/ Linux systems.
  • Solid understanding of core networking and operating systems concepts.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Scripting skills (Python, Powershell, Bash etc.) would be considered advantageous.
  • Passion and curiosity for the cybersecurity industry and technology trends, innovations and frameworks, as well as current IT security technologies.
  • Possess interpersonal skills and the ability to develop effective and lasting relationships with clients and colleagues.
  • Ability to conduct complex analyses and communicate outcomes clearly and concisely.
  • Fluent in both English and Greek language.
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable.

#ChooseDeloitteif:

 

  • You want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skills.
  • You get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
  • You like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others.

description_html:
Junior – ServiceNow - NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di ServiceNow di NextHub di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business di ServiceNow & Emerging Technolgies si occupa di realizzare soluzioni digitali innovative basate su tecnologie emergenti ad alto potenziale di mercato. 
Partendo dall'esigenza dei clienti, propone soluzioni che migliorano i processi di business adottando le funzionalità messe a disposizione dalle tecnologie emergenti. 
Le principali aree organizzative con cui lavorano sono: Sistemi Informativi, Gestione Progetti, Risorse Umane, Gestione Clienti, Amministrazione Finanza e Controllo.

 

Your Role

Junior - La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:

  • Raccogliere ed analizzare i dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti;
  • Collaborare con il team di progetto in modo proattivo e collaborativo per il raggiungimento dell’obiettivo comune
  • Essere costantemente focalizzato sul risultato, sulla responsabilità individuale e sulla qualità del lavoro

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea Triennale/Magistrale in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica (completata oppure a 5/6 mesi dal conseguimento)
  • Competenze IT: Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese   
  • Disponibilità a trasferte e lavoro in presenza in caso di esigenza 

To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description_html:
Senior Data Engineer

What Impact will you make?

#YourOpportunity

Deloitte is proud to be named the #1 consulting service provider in the world by Gartner and a leader in Magic Quadrant for Data and Analytics Service Providers.

We are delivering business advisory and technology-enabled business transformations across the globe, always with a focus to our vision: to make an impact that matters. Within Deloitte, the Engineering, AI & Data team focuses on delivering trusted high-end technology advisory services.

Under this framework, we are currently looking for enthusiastic Senior Data Engineers to become part of our dynamic Technology & Transformation team in our offices in Athens. In this role, you’ll work with cutting-edge technologies to help clients transform their technology platforms and business operations. Partnering with some of the world’s largest organizations, you’ll help COO’s, CFO’s, CIO’s and their teams realize their ambitions – from improving financial performance, to accelerating speed to market and delivering continuous innovation.

Our diverse and passionate team is encouraged to use agile techniques in the development, delivery and on-going management of analytics services and solutions that solve complex business issues through descriptive analytics, advanced visualization, data warehousing, multi-dimensional modelling and business intelligence.

#YourRole
Your role as a Senior Data Engineer will focus on leading the delivery of client engagements, by understanding objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning yours and your team’s work to objectives and setting personal priorities, teaming with others across businesses and borders and taking accountability for own and team results to meet client expectations and project’s desired outcomes.

In this role, you will build relationships and exercise your communication skills in order to positively influence your peers and other stakeholders. You will commit to personal learning and development by actively seeking opportunities for growth, you will share knowledge and experience with others, and act as a strong brand ambassador, embracing our purpose and values in order to put these into practice in your professional life.

During your tenure as a Senior Data Engineer, you will demonstrate and develop your ability to:
  • Participate in large-scale Data Modernization Programs working in international environments;
  • Lead the delivery of both Cloud and On-Premises Data Initiatives and serve as technical expert for Data Engineering teams;
  • Design data-based solutions and data architectures that enable the client’s technology agenda, and communicate market trends and potential impacts effectively to the client;
  • Provide guidance on project delivery approach, defining success criteria, communication plans, resource plans, project plans, etc;
  • Design the architecture of the ETL/ELT jobs by utilizing and combining available components and tools;
  • Assist in the analysis, design, development and testing of Data & Business Intelligence solutions, spanning from data quality sanity checks and data integration controls to data reconciliation across different environments;
  • Train and mentor colleagues and clients alike with best practices;
  • Support and participate in business development activities of the firm.

#WinningRequirements

To qualify for the role you must have:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other related field;
  • Master’s Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science;
  • At least 3 years of relevant work experience;
  • Experience in leading medium to large-scale teams;
  • Knowledge of Data Warehouse, Data Management, Data Architecture, Data Governance and Business Intelligence principles and techniques;
  • Experience in On-Premise technologies stacks such as IBM AS400 (DB2), MS SQL Server and Oracle;
  • Experience in Cloud technology data services such as Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Fabric, AWS Glue and GCP BigQuery;
  • Experience in Data Visualization tools such as Power BI, Qlik and Tableau;
  • Experience in Orchestration solutions such as Control-M and Apache Airflow;
  • Experience in Data Science and AI / ML techniques and tools will be considered a plus;
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills in Greek and in English;
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable.

#AboutTechnology&Transformation

Six core competency areas make up our Technology & Transformation service line:
  • Cyber;
  • Engineering, AI & Data;
  • Enterprise, Technology & Performance;
  • Finance Transformation;
  • Customer;
  • Human Capital.

We exist to solve complex problems
Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Technology & Transformation team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.

We are committed to collaboration
Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.

We create long-term, sustainable impact
We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.

#AboutDeloitte

Our services

Deloitte operates in Greece since 1975, as a member of one of the world’s largest professional services networks, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu. With offices in Athens, Thessaloniki, Heraklion, Patras and Ioannina, Deloitte Greece employs more than 2,900 professionals.


After 50 years of successful and dynamic presence in the Greek market, we bring an unmatched breadth and depth of expertise across audit and assurance, technology & transformation, tax & legal and strategy, risk & transactions advisory services. Operating in a multidisciplinary model enables us to draw from a pool of world-class talent, identifying the ideal skillset for each project, and to collaborate across businesses, to solve the toughest, most challenging issues of our clients. It is with them that we have built a trusted relationship, by delivering innovative solutions and utilizing state-of-the-art tools and technologies across all industries- Consumer Products, Energy Resources & Industrials, Financial Services, Life Sciences & Health Care, Government & Public Services, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.


Our Purpose
Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.

Our values
At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism.
We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.

Our talent experience
From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.

Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

title: Data Engineer
description_html:
DELOITTE DIGITAL
DATA & ANALYTICS

Your Story

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and
beyond.

Your Journey with Us

We're growing our Data & Analytics team and looking for a driven Consultant to help us continue delivering high-
impact solutions for our clients. Our practice provides strategic advisory and end-to-end implementation services that
empower organizations to manage data across multiple sources, transform it into actionable insights, and drive
competitive advantage through analytics.
Our practice delivers end-to-end solutions—spanning data strategy, management, and analytics—leveraging next-
generation technologies such as cloud, big data, machine learning, and AI platforms. We work collaboratively with
clients to solve their most pressing challenges and enable sustainable, data-driven growth.
If you are motivated by challenge, continuous learning, and the opportunity to deliver meaningful impact on a global
scale, Deloitte offers the ideal environment to develop your career.

How you will Make an Impact

Reporting to a manager or project lead, you will contribute to designing, developing, and implementing data solutions
that meet client needs. You will help transform complex business questions into actionable analytics, working across
multiple industries and technology landscapes.
Through this role, you will gain hands-on experience with advanced data engineering tools and practices, while
collaborating with diverse teams to deliver measurable outcomes that enhance client performance.

Your day-to-day tasks will include:
• Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
• Your activities range from business requirements analysis to architecture design (limited), development, and
testing.
• You will participate in assessments of existing data implementations and give advice on structural
improvements in areas of performance: usability, architecture, processes and organisation.
• You will assess, map and translate complex business processes and requirements into a structured analytics
use case.
• You will build data solutions using variety of analytics and visualisation tools and create robust
documentation of solutions and underlying design decisions and operating procedures.

Let’ s Talk About You


At Deloitte, leaders at every level are characterized by their ability to inspire, support and provide opportunities for
people to deliver their best and grow both as professionals and human beings.
Your Leadership skills:
• Builds productive relationships within and across teams; works with others across Deloitte as one team,
sharing information and expertise
• Actively thinks of new ways of doing things that help enhance quality and effectiveness or that contribute
towards building the service offering
• Gains the trust and confidence of others through their actions

Your Professional skills:
• Proactively stays up to date with current and emerging technologies, tools, and frameworks relevant to data
engineering and digital transformation.
• Rapidly adapts to diverse business domains, leveraging strong analytical and economic acumen to
understand business context and challenges.
• Thrives in dynamic environments with a flexible, client-first mindset—capable of switching between multiple
priorities and project types.

Your Specialized skills:
• Preferably a degree in IT, Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field.
• Proficient in cloud platforms (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP), DS workbench tools such as Databricks and Snowflake,
and core technologies like SQL, Python, and Apache Spark for building scalable data solutions. Familiar with
orchestration tools like Airflow and ADF, and version control practices using Git.
• Experience with data modelling, data integration, analytics solutions, machine learning, AI/GenAI is
recommended.
• Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Qlik, or Tableau.
• Familiar with project management methodologies (Agile/Scrum) and collaborative platforms.
• Strong communicator—able to translate complex data insights into business-relevant narratives for both
technical and non-technical audiences.
• Self-disciplined and highly organized when working remotely, with a demonstrated passion for using data and
technology to drive business impact.

What’s in it for you?
You will get the opportunity to work in an innovative environment where personal development and growth are
encouraged.

• You will learn new tools and methodologies, allowing you to become an expert in some areas and diversify
your experience in others.

• You will grow your industry and business specific knowledge in order to maximize the impact our consulting
work will have on our clients.

• Your proficiency and skill level will grow through consistently providing exceptional services to our clients,
growing the developing our offerings and growing our Deloitte brand. This by focusing on key areas like:
solving problems, developing others and self, building relationships, adapting communication styles,
managing change & ambiguity, developing business, managing quality and risk and managing results.


Our Story

Alongside all of Deloitte, we foster the connections necessary to shape a better future for our clients, our culture, our
society, and our planet.

Deloitte Digital Malta is part of a global brand, Deloitte that has been around for the past 175 years and currently has
over 300,000 employees worldwide making us one of the biggest professional service providers worldwide. Over the
years, Deloitte Digital has provided solutions to numerous Maltese organisations across various industries.

We work with our clients to develop customer-centric organisations - helping them take on the challenges of
tomorrow and beyond. With deep expertise in data, creative, technology and strategy, we can help you build the
types of customer journeys that create new growth.

Why Deloitte?

As a Purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the
Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore,
question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning
experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
• Four day work week during the months of July & August.
• Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
• Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents.
• Sponsored mental health support sessions through leading mental health services.
• Weekly get-togethers.
• Deloitte Communities to bring our people together and encourage work/life balance, social life and common
interests.
• Hybrid working flexibility subject to business requirements.
• Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots.
• Renowned training programme with Deloitte University.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

title: Junior - ERP Digital Transformation - NextHub Bari
description_html:
Junior – ERP Digital Transformation – NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire in Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.
I nostri business si occupano di supportare i clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:

  • Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni dei colleghi e del cliente, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
  • Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo e strutturando dati e svolgendo analisi a supporto delle decisioni di business
  • Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team
  • Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea con indirizzo STEM
  • Interesse ad essere inseriti in un contesto consulenziale a contatto e per supporto dei propri colleghi 
  • Familiarità con le piattaforme ERP
  • Forte propensione/interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l’informatica

To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.
In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 
Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: The Deloitte Undergraduate Programme - 2026 Intake
description_html:
The Deloitte Undergraduate Programme 

Kickstart your Career


Here at Deloitte, we value the fresh perspectives of students. What are you passionate about and what are you good at? We believe that strong career paths align with your unique talents and strengths.


You will join a pool of students who are currently completing their Bachelors’/Masters’ degree, just like you. Forming part of a global firm, you will get the opportunity to work alongside professionals who started their journey in the very same way you will.


From the beginning of your journey with us, you will be exposed to different client industries whilst assisting clients in their day-to-day requests, with the aim of helping you grow as a professional in the sector.


What will I do?


From your first year of studies, you'll have the opportunity to work during the Academic year whilst studying, as well as in the summer months. There's flexibility to work at Deloitte on a schedule aligned to your lecture timetable, with time off during exam periods.


We offer services across a variety of specialisations and industries, and you will be allocated to a team where your skills can really flourish. Whichever direction you take, you’ll be taught everything you need to make a real impact in one of our specialist teams whilst supporting client-facing colleagues.


This isn’t just any work experience, you’ll get the opportunity to fulfill a full-time role upon successful completion of your qualification. You’ll get on-the-job experience from day one on innovative and challenging projects. With Deloitte you can enjoy an agile working environment, plenty of training opportunities, an active social life and the chance to join our diversity networks.


Any great benefits for me?


  • Receive an extra stipend during years 4 and 5 (terms apply);
  • Support your career growth with ongoing mentoring and e-learning resources
  • Get support in your dissertation;
  • Receive a financial reward when you graduate with distinction;
  • Get the opportunity to visit Deloitte University in Paris (terms apply) when you graduate and commence full time employment with Deloitte;
  • Participate in social events organized by Deloitte;
  • Have the opportunity to join on full-time basis upon completion of studies;

Why Deloitte?

World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in Audit & Assurance, Tax, Technology & Transformation, and Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory .

As a purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

title: A&A - International Graduate Programme 2026 Intake
description_html:
AUDIT & ASSURANCE

INTERNATIONAL GRADUATE PROGRAMME

Your Story

Did you recently graduate or are about to? Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.


Your Journey with Us

We are currently seeking ambitious newly accounting graduates with exceptional analytical as well as creative skills to bring a fresh perspective to our dynamic Audit Team.

At Deloitte, we recognize there is no one size fits all career path, and global, cross-business mobility and up/re-skilling are all within the range of possibilities to shape a unique and fulfilling career. If you're ready to take your career to the next level in a challenging international environment, focusing on continuous learning and dynamic teamwork, both locally as well as overseas, you're ready for Deloitte!

How you will Make an Impact

As an Audit Senior in the Audit & Assurance Team you are responsible for the accountable and proactive execution of assigned projects, aligning priorities and objectives in order to cater to clients’ needs.

Your main tasks will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Motivates and supports junior staff members to connect to ask technical questions and learn on-the-job and provides technical expertise for junior team members
  • Applies professional skepticism to identify what information is missing or incomplete and takes steps to obtain it
  • Review relevant literature and apply knowledge of business, financial accounting standards, and auditing standards as well as evaluating alternatives in the light of the relevant facts and circumstances, while demonstrating a commitment to quality and professional skepticism

Let’ s Talk About You

Your Leadership skills:

  • Monitors own results against objectives and seeks feedback to identify ways to enhance quality and personal/team performance 
  • Supports respect and inclusion by encouraging an open dialogue with colleagues and valuing individual differences and contributions
  • Builds their own understanding of emerging market trends and educates others accordingly 
  • Ability to communicate and interact effectively with staff at all organizational levels and ability to work on own initiative or as part of a team with minimal supervision.
  • Projects enthusiasm, optimism and commitment to their work and the teams they are part of.

Your Professional skills:

  • Applies tools and systematic approaches to gather and measure information/data from a variety of sources
  • Adapts to changing priorities as they arise and seeks guidance from team leaders.
  • Completes all training and other compliance obligations, including professional certifications, if applicable, on a timely basis
  • Evaluates problem(s) objectively considering facts, relevant professional standards or research, and develops a comprehensive picture of the problem
  • Strong commitment and proven record of professional and client service excellence.

Your Specialized skills:

  • Understands their responsibilities for performing risk assessment, refers to guidance, and appropriately documents their assessment of the risk(s) and planned audit responses
  • Proactively seeks to understand the wider audit timetable, including reviewing and reporting deadlines, and makes sure their work is ready for review on a timely basis
  • Candidates must be in possession of a university degree in Accountancy, or have completed or at an advanced stage of completing their ACCA or ACA professional qualification.
  • A good knowledge of IFRS


Our Story

World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.

Our client-facing Audit & Assurance practice delivers audit, assurance and advisory services of the highest quality. Covering a wide range of industries and markets, be it financial services in multinational corporations to smaller, owner-managed businesses. Our distinctive audit approach and investment in technology enables our Audit & Assurance team to deliver seamless global accounting and auditing services. We are forward thinking, risk focused and insights based.


Why Deloitte?

title: Banking Risk & Regulatory Advisory - Manager/Senior Manager
description_html:
BANKING RISK & REGULATORY ADVISORY

MANAGER / SENIOR MANAGER


Your Story
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.


Your Journey with Us
We are currently seeking to add a Manager or Senior Manager with exceptional analytical and creative skills, and a flair for business, to bring a fresh perspective to our dynamic Risk and Regulatory Advisory Team.

At Deloitte, we recognize there is no one size fits all career path, and global, cross-business mobility and up/re-skilling are all within the range of possibilities to shape a unique and fulfilling career.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level in a challenging international environment, focusing on continuous learning and dynamic teamwork, you're ready for Deloitte!


How you will Make an Impact

The chosen candidate will form part of the Banking Risk & Regulatory Advisory team, focusing on the provision of advisory services on banking financial and prudential regulation, corporate governance, and risk management. The chosen candidate will have opportunities to also work across all areas of our Strategy, Risk and Transactions practice.

The Banking Risk & Regulatory Advisory team sits within Deloitte’s Strategy, Risk and Transactions business which is a leader in the provision of professional services in the areas of Strategy and Transaction Advisory, Regulatory and Financial Risk Advisory, and Internal Audit and Internal Controls Advisory.


Your main tasks will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Assist banking and financial services clients in benchmarking their readiness to implement regulations, providing gap assessments and remediation recommendations that add value and supporting the client in implementing regulatory requirements
  • Assist clients in developing stress testing exercises to analyze the quantitative impact of internal and external shocks and related scenarios to their capital and liquidity reserves
  • Perform quantitative assessments of clients’ capital, liquidity and risk metrics against regulatory thresholds and industry benchmarks
  • Assisting clients in producing and reviewing regulatory reporting requirements, and, together with our data team, supporting clients in implementing reporting controls and automation
  • Carry out research and build technical knowledge on new or changing regulations of interest in all areas of governance, regulatory compliance and risk management
  • Apply previously acquired technical knowledge on relevant regulatory, compliance or risk topics in a relevant and proportionate manner to the client’s business and circumstances
  • Draft policies and procedures that reflect the client’s internal processes and include recommendations made to strengthen internal controls and regulatory compliance
  • Document work performed and findings in a logical, thorough and structured manner, in line with firm methodology and relevant guidance, including communicating findings to senior management
  • Advise the client on solving control design issues based on industry leading practices and regulatory requirement


Let’ s Talk About You

Your leadership and professional skills:

  • Keen interest in developing and nurturing client relationships, and assisting our clients in finding solutions to their challenges using a multi-disciplinary and technology-driven approach
  • Oversee the performance of team members on a regular basis; provides timely and honest feedback to drive high performance and quality output, and to aid their team members’ development
  • Builds and maintains productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders and colleagues, across a broad network, based on mutual respect and trust
  • Applies industry and competitor knowledge to build solutions that are in line with market trends, and, in so doing, challenges existing practices and brings in innovative solutions from across the market or Deloitte
  • Manages end-to-end engagement planning for complex engagements from the earliest stages to avoid delays and challenges by setting objectives, identifying deliverables, planning schedules and resource deployment in alignment with engagement skills requirements
  • Sets tone by leading teams in application of appropriate tools, methodologies, quality and risk protocols, relevant regulatory frameworks, professional standards and regulatory requirements
  • Responds to unexpected situations by identifying out-of-the-box alternatives and ideas to adapt with agility, including supporting teams to understand the need to adapt when required
  • Consistently identifies opportunities to advance our eminence building agenda in the marketplace through current engagements/interventions and through collaborations within the team


Your Specialized skills:

  • Minimum of 5-8 years’ working experience with a focus on banking risk and regulatory compliance, within Risk, Compliance, Finance or similar area
  • University degree in Banking and Finance, Risk Management, Business Administration, Accounting or a related field
  • Demonstrated experience in financial risk management and quantitative outputs
  • Excellent written and spoken English


Ways to stand out from the crowd

  • Experience within a supervisory role, or within the second or third line of defence of a business, will be considered favourably
  • Any experience working on financial risk tools, application of modelling techniques or management of stress testing exercises, including the ICAAP, ILAAP and Recovery Plan, will be considered an asset
  • Knowledge and experience of the Supervisory Review and Evaluation Process (SREP), the new Capital Requirements Regulation and Directive (CRD6/CRR3), and/or EBA and MFSA guidance around aspects of banking regulation, and their implementation in practice


Our Story
A world-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, tax & legal, strategy, risk and transactions advisory, and technology and transformation.

Our team specialises in collaborating with clients’ leadership to improve processes and procedures in areas such as risk management, internal audit, regulatory compliance, and technology. The ultimate aim is to assist organisations and businesses across a different range of industries, in reducing, managing and mitigating a wide range of risks, enabling them to take intelligent and well-informed risk decisions.


Why Deloitte?

As a Purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • 4-day work week during the months of July & August.
  • Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
  • Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents. 
  • Sponsored mental health support sessions through leading mental health services.
  • Deloitte Communities to bring our people together and encourage work/life balance, social life and common interests.
  • Monthly get-togethers with the team
  • Hybrid working flexibility subject to business requirements.
  • Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots.
  • Renowned training programme with Deloitte University.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description_html:
What Impact will you make?  

Are you looking for an opportunity in Thessaloniki that offers you a hybrid working model?   
 
Are you ready to work on large scale projects for industry-leading clients around the world and elevate your career to an international level?  
 
If so, check below for more info about this career opportunity!  
 
You bring passion, we bring opportunities!  
 

#YourOpportunity  

Deloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Since 2018, Deloitte has been operating its Competence Center in Thessaloniki with satellites in the cities of Patras, Heraklion, and Ioannina - which are model hubs of expertise, training, and innovation, specializing in cutting-edge exponential technologies, in which graduates and young professionals undergo immersive experiences, continuous learning, gaining practical insights and hands-on training that empower them to navigate the complexities of the digital landscape.  
 
Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team. 


#YourServiceLine: Technology & Transformation

Our Technology & Transformation teams empower organizations to navigate the future through technology-driven business transformation. Combining deep industry knowledge with cutting-edge technology, we deliver tailored solutions that drive innovation, enhance efficiency, promote cybersecurity, and foster sustainable growth


#AboutYourTeam

Our UI/UX Designers team supports customers in adopting advanced technological solutions by defining interaction strategies that meet business needs. Working alongside technical experts, we help create reliable and impactful digital experiences that give clients a real competitive advantage.

• Designing solutions that simplify complex processes, making them more intuitive and efficient for users, and ensuring enterprise systems operate smoothly.
• Designing cohesive interactions and visual frameworks that ensure a clear, consistent experience across applications 
• Developing scalable and reusable design solutions that can be applied across systems, supporting efficiency, reliability, and improved user experiences while reducing delivery time.
 

#OurRequirements

Key Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in UX/UI Design, Graphic Design, Interaction Design, or a related field, or equivalent working experience.
• Hands-on experience with industry-standard design tools such as Figma (or similar collaborative design tools).
• Understanding of the end-to-end UX/UI design process.
• Practical knowledge of user-centered design principles, wireframing, prototyping, and interaction patterns.
• Strong visual design skills with a good understanding of typography, color, and layout.
• Familiarity with responsive and mobile-first design approaches.
• Ability to interpret and apply user research insights, data, and requirements to inform design decisions.
• Demonstrated ability to solve user problems through structured and thoughtful design solutions.
• Ability to define and measure design outcomes aligned with business and user goals.
• Ability to articulate design logic to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Experience producing developer-ready deliverables (specs, documentation, assets) and participating in iterative handoff processes.
• Ability to work independently as well as in a highly collaborative, team-based environment.
• Ability to effectively prioritize and plan workload to meet deadlines.
• A portfolio demonstrating UX thinking, process artifacts (research, flows, decisions), and visual outcomes.
• Proficiency in English (written and spoken).
• Availability to travel, depending on project needs.
• Submission of a portfolio is a mandatory requirement for the position.
 
#PreferredQualifications

• Experience working with design systems and component libraries, including using existing systems and contributing to their evolution.
• Experience in Service Design and Interaction Design within complex or enterprise contexts.
• Knowledge of accessibility principles (WCAG) and a willingness to apply them.
• Familiarity with agile project workflows and cross-functional collaboration.
• Writing skills for UX copywriting.
• Basic understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
• Familiarity with analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics) to understand usage patterns and user behavior.
• Experience or interest in facilitating or supporting design thinking workshops.
• Experience with tools that leverage AI for ideation, accessibility checks, or content generation.
• Italian language (written and spoken) is a plus.

🏠 Modern hybrid workplace, characterized by flexibility and Smart Working

title: Experienced - Accountant FSI
description_html:
Experienced - Accountant FSI

Stiamo cercando una figura consultant/senior consultant da inserire nel team FSI di Deloitte Business Solution, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.
Il business di Operation FSI si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti in attività di:
  • Accounting, Finance & Controlling: in un contesto di network nazionale ed internazionale, formiamo soluzioni a supporto della "compliance" civilistica, fiscale, gestionale e di processo in situazioni sia di continuità che di discontinuità aziendale (operazioni/eventi straordinari)
  • Acquisizioni, Fusioni, Cessioni e Scorpori: supportiamo operativamente i nostri clienti in progetti di discontinuità, trasformazione, contingenza, integrazione, riorganizzazione, gestione della fase di execution in entità complesse (aziende di medio/grandi dimensioni, multinazionali).

Your Role
La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di operare con le funzioni Accounting, Finance & Controlling e coordinare i membri del team nel supporto dall’operatività aziendale, con particolare focus sulla:
  • gestire attività di corretta tenuta delle scritture contabili e delle relative scadenze
  • verifica e calcolo degli stanziamenti mensili e predisposizione delle scritture di rettifica/integrazione, assestamento/ accertamento
  • redazione di bilanci di esercizio/separati e di bilanci consolidati secondo i principi contabili di riferimento (IAS/IFRS)
  • Sarai parte integrante di team dedicati a condurre per l’area Accounting, Finance & Controlling processi e progetti di Closing/Fast Closing e Reporting nel rispetto della Compliance di riferimento (es. applicazione di diversi principi contabili e di diversi criteri di valutazione: es. Civilistici, Gestionali, Di Gruppo, Fiscali ecc.)

Winning Requirements
  • Laurea in Materie Economiche o Affini
  • Esperienza comprovata di almeno 3 anni nell’Industry dei Financial Services presso società di consulenza e/o realtà finanziarie con processi strutturati in ambito Accounting, Finance & Controlling (AFC)
  • Conoscenza base dei principi contabili nazionali ed internazionali (IAS/IFRS), nonché capacità di analisi dei processi aziendali, in particolare quelli relativi all’area AFC
  • Buona conoscenza del pacchetto applicativi Microsoft (Office) e dei principali ERP (Sap, Oracle ecc.)
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese

To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: Accounting & Reporting Advisory Senior
description_html:
AUDIT & ASSURANCE

ACCOUNTING & REPORTING ADVISORY SENIOR


Your Story

Do you have strong technical expertise and an unrelenting drive to excel? You are not alone. At Deloitte, you’ll be surrounded by like-minded professionals who share your passion for growth and excellence, ready to support you as you tackle complex challenges and make a meaningful impact.


Your Journey with Us

Deloitte is seeking a driven and ambitious Accounting and Reporting Advisory Senior with exceptional technical expertise and a passion for innovation to bring fresh perspectives and impactful solutions to our dynamic Accounting and Reporting Advisory Team. At Deloitte, we recognize there is no one size fits all career path, and global, cross-business mobility and up/re-skilling are all within the range of possibilities to shape a unique and fulfilling career. If you're ready to take your career to the next level in a challenging international environment, focusing on continuous learning and dynamic teamwork, both locally as well as overseas, you're ready for Deloitte!


How you will Make an Impact

As an Advisory Senior in the Audit & Assurance Team, you will take ownership of technical reporting projects, managing and delivering multiple client engagements while ensuring alignment with client objectives and building strong client relationships. You will be tasked with preparing high quality deliverables, proactively identifying and addressing potential issues, and demonstrating initiative and critical thinking to deliver impactful solutions. Additionally, the firm will support you in staying up to date with the latest accounting standards and regulatory frameworks, enabling you to deliver accurate and technically robust solutions.

Your main tasks will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Prepare detailed advisory reports and memos for clients, providing technical guidance on financial reporting matters and complex transactions.
  • Conduct in-depth research on financial reporting standards and regulations, with a focus on IFRS and GAPSME.
  • Prepare and review consolidation workings and group reporting packages in line with IFRS and other applicable frameworks.
  • Assist clients in the preparation and review of financial statements, ensuring compliance with relevant accounting standards and timely financial reporting.
  • Prepare and review consolidation workings and group reporting packages in line with IFRS and other applicable frameworks.
  • Support audit teams in addressing complex accounting transactions and provide support for technical queries related to financial reporting.
  • Contribute to the delivery of training on accounting standards and other financial reporting requirements to clients and finance teams.
  • Stay informed on changes to accounting standards and local regulatory requirements, advising clients on their implications and implementation strategies.
  • Contribute to the firm’s thought leadership by drafting articles on financial reporting trends and developments.
  • Identify opportunities to enhance efficiency in clients’ accounting and financial reporting processes, and support in the implementation of financial reporting modules within ERP systems.


Let’ s Talk About You

Your Leadership skills:

  • Monitors own results against objectives and seeks feedback to identify ways to enhance quality and personal/team performance. 
  • Exhibits a strong sense of intrinsic motivation and drive, consistently seeking opportunities to take ownership of tasks and deliver exceptional results.
  • Ability to communicate and interact effectively with staff at all organizational levels and ability to work on own initiative or as part of a team with minimal supervision.
  • Projects enthusiasm, optimism and commitment to their work and the teams they are part of.
  • Encourages team development by fostering an environment of continuous learning and knowledge-sharing.


Your Professional skills:

  • Applies tools and systematic approaches to gather and measure information from a variety of sources.
  • Completes all training and other compliance obligations, including professional certifications, if applicable, on a timely basis.
  • Evaluates problem(s) objectively considering facts, relevant professional standards or research, and develops a comprehensive picture of the problem.
  • Proactively identifies opportunities for process improvement and recommends innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
  • Shows resilience and problem-solving skills when navigating complex challenges, maintaining focus on delivering high-quality outcomes.


Your Specialized skills:

  • Candidates must be in possession of a recognised degree in accounting or be in the final stages of completing one.
  • Use of the relevant internal and external knowledge databases and exploitation of the relevant information to benefit clients and the firm.
  • An analytical mindset, demonstrating a passion for technical accounting and a commitment to staying current with industry standards and changes.
  • Any practical experience in a finance or auditing role will be considered an asset.


Our Story
World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory. We take great pride in supporting clients with multidisciplinary expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative solutions.

Our Assurance team is a dedicated team of professionals within the audit department with deep financial reporting skills and in-depth industry knowledge. We cover a wide range of industries and markets, from financial services in multinational corporations to smaller, owner-managed businesses. Our distinctive audit approach and investment in technology enables our Audit team to deliver seamless global accounting and auditing services. We are forward thinking, risk focused and insights based.


Why Deloitte?

As a Purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
  • Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents. 
  • Sponsored mental health support sessions through leading mental health services.
  • Weekly get-togethers.
  • Deloitte Communities to bring our people together and encourage work/life balance, social life and common interests.
  • Hybrid working flexibility subject to business requirements.
  • Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots. 
  • Renowned training program with Deloitte University.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

What Impact will you make?

Are you ready to work on large scale projects for industry-leading clients around the world and elevate your career to an international level?

If so, check below for more info about this career opportunity!

You bring passion, we bring opportunities!

#YourOpportunity

Deloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team.

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

#AboutYourTeam

Deloitte’s Controls Assurance team provides IT Controls Assurance services and Internal Audit, including reporting internal control remediation and testing, risk assessment support and impact assessment and reporting. Deloitte’s Controls Assurance capabilities include digital controls and are particularly relevant in supporting finance transformation projects.

​Through these services we support businesses to enhance their internal controls over financial and non-financial corporate reporting to improve operational effectiveness and efficiency. ​

We also provide controls assessment solutions and guidance to first and second line for audit readiness, financial accounting and financial reporting, as well as deliver Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) controls modernization and rationalization, plus SOX uplift for new and emerging public companies.

#AboutYourRole

As an IT Audit Senior Consultant you will:

  • Be part of a diverse team, you contribute to the growth of our Controls Assurance practice using your strategic insight and account management skills.
  • Lead challenging and diversified assurance & advisory projects at large  companies, as well as SME’s. Next to that, you will be working in different industries such as financial services, technology, telecom and others.
  • Manage a team and perform in-depth assessments and related advisory to provide ISAE, SOC reports or similar, covering business processes, applications, and technology infrastructure for our clients together with your team.
  • Evaluate and report on controls over the security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, or privacy over information and systems across an entire entity or its subsidiaries.
  • Providing strategic advice to senior client staff (CxO, Senior Risk/Security officers, …) on topics such as risk, audit, continuity, governance, quality, sourcing, analytics, etc. to enhance our client’s business value and effectiveness.
  • Influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people 
  • Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, align people to objectives and set priorities and direction.


#OurRequirements

Key Qualifications

The ideal candidate should have the following requirements:

  • Degree in Technical/Scientific subjects (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics with ICT address etc.).
  • Strong understanding of Operating Systems , Data bases and IT environments ;
  • Excellent knowledge of English (written and spoken);
  • Mastery of the Office package;
  • Motivated with a positive attitude to work in team, solve problems and analytical mindset;
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; and
  • Ambition for further professional development.
  • Between 2 and 5 years of experience in IT Audits and ISAE Audits.
  • Highly developed project and people management skills including experience with managing millennials.
  • Highly developed project and people management skills including experience with managing millennials.
  • Experience with managing projects end-to-end.


Bonus Qualifications

  • Experience in financial services industry (banking, insurance, payments, fintechs, etc) is a plus.
  • Knowledge on System Security (i.e. Firewalls) is a plus;
  • Certifications such as COBIT, ITIL, CISA, Prince2, CIA, etc. are a plus.
  • Knowledge of French or Dutch will be considered a plus but is not mandatory to apply;

If you're ready to take your career to the next level in a challenging international environment, focusing on continuous learning and dynamic teamwork, you're ready for Deloitte!


#WhatWeOffer

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits:


🏠 Modern hybrid workplace, characterized by flexibility and Smart Working

⚖ Empowered well-being: We provide multiple program offerings to support your well-being needs (flexible working arrangements, extra days of leave, parental allowances)

🌍 Engagement within international large-scale teams and projects, with opportunities to travel for training or client purposes.

📚 Constant opportunities for learning with unlimited access to internal and external learning platforms and sponsored certificates aligned with business needs and technology trends

🚀 Challenging and innovating environment where personal development and growth are encouraged, always with transparency and trust

? Diverse culture and active communities that enable you to bring yourself to work

🎉 Team Building and Corporate Social Responsibility Activities

🏃 A buddy to support you with your onboarding

🌴 Extra days of annual leave

⚕ Private medical health insurance plan

💳 Ticket restaurant card

? Exclusive Discounts to several retail providers, restaurants and others

📱 Mobile phone

🍏 Fresh fruits and unlimited coffee everyday at our offices

Please note that all the well-being benefits mentioned above are subject to annual review 


 About Deloitte

#OurServices

Deloitte offers integrated services that include Audit & Assurance, Tax and Legal, Strategy-Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.

title: Auditor Finanziamenti Agevolati a Imprese - Audit & Assurance
description_html:
Auditor Finanziamenti Agevolati a Imprese - Audit & Assurance

Descrizione dell’opportunità

Ricerchiamo laureati in Economia con almeno 6 mesi di esperienza lavorativa post-laurea, interessati ad attività di controllo e monitoraggio su finanziamenti agevolati a imprese finanziati con fondi comunitari o nazionali, nel rispetto della normativa in materia di aiuti di Stato e delle disposizioni europee e nazionali sull’ammissibilità della spesa.

Attività principali

La risorsa sarà coinvolta in attività di:
• verifica amministrativo-contabile dei progetti di investimento delle imprese  finanziati con risorse comunitarie o nazionali;

• controllo di conformità rispetto alla normativa nazionale e comunitaria applicabile, inclusa la disciplina sugli aiuti di Stato;
• analisi della documentazione tecnica, amministrativa e contabile presentata dalle imprese beneficiarie;
• predisposizione di report di controllo e monitoraggio a supporto della Committente;
• interazione con imprese e soggetti attuatori nell’ambito dei procedimenti di verifica e controllo;

• Disponibilità a presenza presso la sede del cliente

Requisiti preferenziali


• Laureato/a in Economia 

• Iscrizione all’Albo o al Registro dei Praticanti dei Revisori Contabili e Dottori Commercialisti;

• Precedente esperienza presso Pubbliche Amministrazioni o studi professionali in materia di finanza agevolata o controllo su contributi pubblici;
• Conoscenza della normativa in materia di aiuti di Stato e delle regole sull’ammissibilità della spesa;
• Ottima conoscenza di Excel e dimestichezza con piattaforme informatiche di monitoraggio e rendicontazione;
• Attitudine al lavoro in team, precisione e capacità analitiche;

• Conoscenza della lingua inglese.

Tipologia contrattuale


• Contratto di consulenza a partita IVA.

Sede di lavoro


• Puglia

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory, Tax & Legal e Technology & Transformation. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

What Impact will you make?

Data Intelligence Engineer@ Thessaloniki

Are you looking for an opportunity in Thessaloniki, Greece that offers you a hybrid working model? 



Are you ready to work on international projects for industry-leading clients around the world and elevate your tech consulting career to an international level? 



If so, check below for more info about this career opportunity! 



You bring passion, we bring opportunities!

  

#YourOpportunity  

Deloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Since 2018, Deloitte has been operating its Competence Center in Thessaloniki with satellites in the cities of Patras, Heraklion, and Ioannina - which are model hubs of expertise, training, and innovation, specializing in cutting-edge exponential technologies, in which graduates and young professionals undergo immersive experiences, continuous learning, gaining practical insights and hands-on training that empower them to navigate the complexities of the digital landscape. 

 

Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team. 

  

#YourServiceLine 

Technology & Transformation  

Our Technology & Transformation teams empower organizations to navigate the future through technology-driven business transformation. Combining deep industry knowledge with cutting-edge technology, we deliver tailored solutions that drive innovation, enhance efficiency, promote cybersecurity, and foster sustainable growth.  

  

#AboutYourTeam 

Our Data Engineering Team as part of our Engineering, AI & Data service line in Thessaloniki operates in diverse teams, has a detail-oriented mindset and analytical thinking skills, understands and interpret business requirements and transform them into actionable data processes.


In your role in Deloitte, you will be focused on functional analysis and development of data management processes, while working with a progressively - increasing autonomy within multi-functional teams.

For a full coverage of your role, you ought to be able to:

  • Design, build and maintain enterprise-grade reporting and analytics solutions for large-scale clients across Banking, Energy, Utilities and Public Sector
  • Act as a bridge between data engineering, data modelling and business reporting
  • Deliver high-quality, scalable and trusted insights in complex reporting environments

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI
  • Build and maintain semantic models (star/snowflake schemas, measures, hierarchies)
  • Implement advanced DAX calculations, KPIs and business logic
  • Collaborate with data engineers to consume data from modern data platforms (e.g. Azure, Databricks, Fabric)
  • Ensure data quality, reconciliation and consistency across reports and data models
  • Translate business and regulatory requirements into robust reporting solutions
  • Optimize report performance, usability and scalability
  • Support end-users and stakeholders with insights, documentation and best practices
 

#OurRequirements 

Key Qualifications 

  • Bachelor / Master’s degree in Computer science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or in similar technical-scientific disciplines (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Statistics)

  • Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in complex reporting environments
  • Strong expertise in Power BI (Desktop, Service, data models, DAX)
  • Solid understanding of data modelling principles (fact/dimension modelling)
  • Experience working with SQL and structured data sources
  • Exposure to data engineering concepts (ETL/ELT, pipelines, data lakes/warehouses)
  • Experience working with large datasets and enterprise-scale reporting solutions
  • Ability to work in multi-stakeholder, fast-paced consulting environments

Nice to Have

  • Experience with Azure Data Platform (Azure SQL, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric)
  • Familiarity with regulatory or management reporting (e.g. Finance, Risk, Operations)
  • Knowledge of version control (Git) and deployment best practices
  • Experience with performance tuning and optimization in Power BI
  • Consulting or client-facing experience

Individuals who have a strong will to expand their knowledge of new technologies, a passion to grow within the company and aspirations for career growth. At Deloitte we foster a consultative culture because the best decisions are made in collaboration with others. We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact. These are not aspirations, but principles that we all commit to today and every day.

🌍 Engagement within international large-scale teams and projects, with opportunities to travel for training or client purposes

📚 Constant opportunities for learning with unlimited access to internal and external learning platforms and sponsored certificates aligned with business needs and technology trends

🚀 Challenging and innovating environment where personal development and growth are encouraged, always with transparency and trust

👬 Diverse culture and active communities that enable you to bring yourself to work

🎉 Team Building and Corporate Social Responsibility Activities

🏃 A buddy to support you with your onboarding

⚕️ Private medical health insurance plan

💳 Ticket restaurant card

 🛍️ Exclusive Discounts to several retail providers, restaurants and others

 📱 Mobile phone

 🍏 Fresh fruits and unlimited coffee everyday at our offices

Please note that all the well-being benefits mentioned above are subject to annual review

Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our  team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.
 
We are committed to collaboration
 
Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It is why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We are also unafraid to challenge.  In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.
 
We create long-term, sustainable impact
 
We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it is about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.

 
#AboutDeloitte
 
Our services
 
Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
 
We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.

We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.
 
Our talent experience
 
From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the center of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.

 

Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.
