title: Junior - Finance Tech Transformation
description_html:
Junior – Finance Tech Transformation 

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Finance Transformation di Deloitte nelle sedi di Milano e Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid. 
Il team Finance Transformation si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:
  • Program & Project Management di iniziative complesse di Finance Transformation finalizzati a rendere le funzioni aziendali efficienti e in grado di supportare le esigenze dei nostri clienti Corporate, in linea con i cambiamenti normativi e i trend di trasformazione digitale;
  • Analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi amministrativo-contabili attraverso la raccolta dei requisiti funzionali e tecnici necessari all’implementazione dei sistemi gestionali di ultima generazione (es. SAP S4);
  • Disegno e implementazione di modelli di controllo di gestione, pianificazione, forecasting e reporting sulle principali piattaforme di mercato (es. Oracle EPM, SAP BPC);
  • Analisi e implementazione di soluzioni di Hyperautomation su tutti i processi aziendali, con un particolare focus verso le nuove tecnologie innovative (es. Robotic Process Automation, Machine Learning, ChatBot, iOCR, Worlflow Management, …);
  • Disegno di Modelli di Reporting, Performance Management, Finance Analytics;
  • Supporto end-to-end nel percorso di trasformazione digitale di tutti i processi aziendali, attraverso lo sviluppo di business cases per analisi costi vs benefici delle iniziative di trasformazione. 

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale/magistrale in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica, o lauree STEM (conseguita o a 5/6 mesi dal conseguimento);
  • Forte interesse per iniziative di Finance Transformation della funzione AFC, oltre a una propensione per l’innovazione tecnologica e per le soluzioni di Digital Finance;
  • Spiccata capacità di analisi dei dati, sensibilità al business, gestione della complessità e attitudine verso la tecnologia;
  • Conoscenza di processi aziendali quali bilancio, bilancio consolidato, budgeting e pianificazione (forecasting);
  • Conoscenza base dei Database relazionali e dei linguaggi di interrogazione (SQL), di soluzioni software in ambito CPM (Oracle, SAP, Tagetik, Qlik, Tableau, Board);
  • Disponibilità a trasferte in Italia e all’estero e fluente conoscenza della lingua inglese.

To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.
In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: Salesforce Analysts
description_html:
Salesforce Analysts

 

What Impact will you make?

#YourOpportunity

We are currently looking for enthusiastic Salesforce Analysts to join our dynamic and highly motivating Deloitte Digital team in Athens.  

Deloitte is the first ranked consulting company delivering business advisory and technology enabled business transformations across the globe. Within Deloitte, our teams focus on delivering trusted high-end technology advisory services.

Should you be a cloud technologies enthusiast, with a great affinity for the business side of a problem, interested in helping our clients maximize the value of their customer relationships, passionate about improving processes and motivated to take on new challenges across industries, in Greece as well as internationally, this is the opportunity to do so.  

At Deloitte, you will gain exposure to a variety of industries and business models, helping your career growth and professional development.

 

#YourRole

Your role as a Salesforce Analyst in Deloitte will focus on helping our clients identify and solve their most critical challenges through technology. In this role, you will commit to personal learning and development and explore opportunities to make an impact by delivering exceptional client services.

During your tenure as an Analyst, you will demonstrate and develop your ability to:
 

  • Collaborate with clients to identify objectives and business needs and effectively map them into system capabilities, using the most suitable methodologies and best practices  
  • Document detailed business, functional & technical requirements and propose best practices and optimizations
  • Design and implement enterprise-scale cloud CRM solutions to address business challenges, using declarative or low-code application building tools, making the most of the latest technologies
  • Participate in client opportunities, preparation of proposals and RFP responses, building of proof-of-concepts (PoCs) and demos
  • Setup and configure Salesforce cloud solutions and related third-party applications
  • Prepare and deploy CRM solutions to Test and Production environments
  • Stay up to date with the latest innovations, new products & enhancements, and apply them accordingly to client issues when needed.
  • Obtain & maintain certifications that will leverage your knowledge & expertise
  • Have a team spirit and effectively collaborate in cross-functional and international teams
     

#WinningRequirements

  • University or Technological Educational Institution degree in Engineering or technical disciplines
  • Post-graduate degree in relevant fields will be considered an asset
  • 0-2 years of proven experience in a consulting firm or in industry-focused CRM projects
  • Salesforce experience and/or certifications will be considered a plus
  • Analytical thinking and business analysis skills for effectively translating business objectives to system design
  • Self-motivated and willingness to pursue personal development though specialization and professional certifications
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Excellent command in spoken and written English and Greek language
  • Military obligations fulfilled for male candidates

 

#AboutTechnology & Transformation

Six core competency areas make up our Technology & Transformation service line:

  • Cyber;
  • Engineering, AI & Data;
  • Enterprise Technology & Performance;
  • Finance Transformation;
  • Deloitte Digital;
  • Human Capital.

 

We exist to solve complex problems

 Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Consulting team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.

We are committed to collaboration

Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge.  In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.

We create long-term, sustainable impact  

We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.
 

#ChooseDeloitteif

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
 

#AboutDeloitte

Our services

Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.

Our Purpose

Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.

Our values

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements.

Our talent experience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.


Build your legacy with us. Aim higher: join Deloitte now!

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description_html:
Senior Penetration Tester


What Impact will you make?

 

#YourOpportunity

 

Do you thrive at solving complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides exceptional career experience and an inclusive and collaborative culture? Want to make an impact that matters? Consider joining Deloitte.

We are currently seeking for enthusiastic team players with exceptional penetration testing skills and a well-rounded personality to become part of our dynamic Cyber team based in Athens. The team is part of a global network, where brilliant colleagues collaborate across Deloitte locations, to deliver services to our clients both in Greece and abroad.

As a Senior Penetration Tester, you will work in a highly skilled team to perform various Penetration Testing and Red Teaming engagements for our domestic and international clients. Using your offensive skills, you will covertly breach our clients’ networks and provide recommendations to strengthen the client’s security posture. To sharpen your skills, you will be trained with the Offensive Security trainings; you will join the periodic Deloitte Global Ethical Hacking and Red Team knowledge exchange sessions, and perform research on the latest techniques and tools. Moreover, you will serve as a “Subject Matter Expert”, adding interpretive value to findings presented and be responsible for creating and executing custom penetration testing engagements to identify if client systems are vulnerable to security issues.

 

#YourRole


Your role as a Senior Penetration Tester will enable you to work alongside fellow Ethical Hackers, who are incredibly passionate about what they do and are characterised by their commitment to working as a team, and their ever-present customer focus. In this role, you will actively participate in technical planning and the delivery of best-in-class service to our clients. In this role, you will find yourself in a personal learning and development fast track and will be given many opportunities to get exposure and make an impact that matters.


During your tenure as a Senior Penetration Tester, you will be able to:

  • Be part of a truly global community of Deloitte experts in Ethical Hacking and Cyber Security;
  • Work on projects focused on identifying security vulnerabilities on client’s infrastructure, Web and Mobile Apps etc.;
  • Find creative ways to obtain a foothold in a client's network;
  • Apply an adversary mindset to simulate sophisticated actors and achieve project-specific objectives;
  • Stealthily move laterally within client’s IT environments, making sure not to trigger any alarms;
  • Perform research and develop your own tools and sharpen your tradecraft;
  • Share your research within the Deloitte Global Hacking and Red Team community;
  • Turning security weaknesses into tailored and concrete recommendations;
  • Translate technical issues into business risks;
  • Facilitating Purple Team workshops and training defensive teams of clients in to identify tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) used by adversaries;
  • Receive training and attain certifications in the use of cutting-edge cybersecurity products but also on various cybersecurity engineering topics.


#WinningRequirements


To qualify for the role, you must have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Information Systems Security, Cybersecurity, or related work experience
  • Experience with penetration testing like Web Application, Mobile, Infrastructure and Vulnerability Assessments both on *nix and Windows environments;
  • Expertise using Kali Linux and tools like Burp, Metasploit, Covenant, Cobalt Strike, and Nessus;
  • Experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives;
  • Demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience;
  • Consultant mindset, commitment to teamwork, and ability to build strong client relationships.
  • Strong communication skills (in Greek and in English).
  • Ability to maintain professionalism and always strive for high ethical standards.
  • 3+ years of experience in Penetration Testing and/or Red Teaming;
  • Willingness to research new security testing techniques and tradecraft;
  • Preferred hands on experience with Red Teaming.

 Ideally:

  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable
  • Preferred professional qualifications: OSCP, OSEP, OSCE, OSWE, CRTO, PACES etc.
  • Web Security Academy (PortSwigger)
  • Hack the Box level: Pro Hacker

#ChooseDeloitteif:

  • You want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skills.
  • You get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
  • You like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others.

 

#AboutDeloitte


Our services

Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.


Our Purpose

Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.


Our values

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements.


Our talent experience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged, and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.

 

Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

title: Categorie Protette - Junior STEM - Nexthub Bari
description_html:
Categorie Protette - Junior STEM - NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando figure junior/consultant da inserire in NextHub, sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il nostro Hub ha l’obiettivo di fornire ai giovani e a tutti i professionisti solide competenze nella trasformazione digitale del Paese e in particolare nel Mezzogiorno.

YourRole

In quanto Analyst/Consultant avrai la possibilità di imparare dai colleghi più Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali, occupandoti di:

- Interpretare proattivamente le richieste dei colleghi, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti

- Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo e strutturando dati e svolgendo analisi a supporto dei colleghi

- Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team

- Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali 

Winning Requirements

- Appartenenza alle Categorie Protette Art. 1 legge 68/99

- Diploma o laurea in ambito economico, informatica o ingegneristico-scientifico (STEM)

- Interesse ad essere inseriti in un contesto consulenziale a contatto ed a supporto dei propri colleghi

- Interesse ad specializzarti nell'analizzare e supportare i colleghi in processi aziendali tra cui Finance, Produzione, Human Resources, Supply chain,  mondo ERP, Customer & Sales, Engineering, AI&Data, Tax, Audit, Climate&Sustainability, Officine Innovazione e tanti altri.

- Conoscenza di Microsoft Office con un focus particolare su Excel e Power Point

- Conoscenza della lingua inglese 

Make An Impact That Matters

l network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone. 

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che - in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti - hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Deloitte Business Solution collabora con i propri clienti/partner nella conduzione, gestione e riorganizzazione dei processi aziendali relativi alle Funzioni Accounting, Finance & Controlling; individua e valuta i cambiamenti necessari, assistendo nell’implementazione di percorsi strutturati di sviluppo, alla ricerca della migliore performance in termini di efficienza, efficacia e controllo.

Your Role

La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:
  • Assumere responsabilità per i risultati del proprio workstream, garantendo pieno allineamento con gli obiettivi di progetto e gli standard di qualità di Deloitte;
  • Guidare la raccolta e gestione dei dati necessari alla formulazione di ipotesi e proposte, utilizzando un approccio strutturato al problem solving; mostrare maturità professionale in situazioni complesse e delicate, fungendo da modello per i colleghi junior;

title: Experienced - Cyber Data Protection
description_html:
Experienced - Cyber Data Protection


We are seeking a Consultant/Senior Consultant to join the Data Protection team in Milan and Rome, working in a Hybrid mode.
The Data Protection business supports our clients in optimizing their cybersecurity strategies, design cutting-edge solutions in the data protection fields and govern enterprise security programs that increase resilience and better manage cyber risks, and designing innovative data protection solutions and services.




Your Role



The Experienced resource will be integrated into a work team and responsible for:

  • Manage data protection activities within wider projects, identifying, evaluating, and designing best in class data protection solutions, demonstrating operational excellence, vision and strategic thinking
  • Execute complex project activities, coordinate part of the team while supporting your more senior colleagues in managing client relations and expectations
  • Face and solve customer challenges in innovative and effective way
  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to strengthen business relations and create business opportunities




Winning Requirements


  • 2-6 years of experience, preferably in a Strategic Consulting company or Global System Integrator
  • Solid expertise in Data Privacy and GDPR, Data Protection solutions (e.g. DLP, CASB, Data Discovery and Data Masking, Data Encryption and Key Management), Data Protection Assessment and Benchmarks
  • Fluent knowledge of English language
  • Passion and curiosity for the cybersecurity industry and technology trends, innovations and frameworks, as well as current IT security technologies




Make an Impact that Matters



Deloitte is a global leader in professional services, operating in over 150 countries with a network of more than 460,000 professionals.
In Italy, Deloitte is located in 24 cities with approximately 13,400 professionals supporting clients through services in Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Tax & Legal.

Through Impact for Italy, the Italian branch of WorldImpact, Deloitte has launched projects in collaboration with institutions, non-profit organizations, universities, and other stakeholders—leaving a lasting legacy across the country.

title: A&A - External Senior Auditor
description_html:
AUDIT & ASSURANCE

AUDIT SENIOR

Your Story

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.


Your Journey with Us

We are currently seeking ambitious Audit Seniors with exceptional analytical as well as creative skills to bring a fresh perspective to our dynamic Audit Team.

At Deloitte, we recognize there is no one size fits all career path, and global, cross-business mobility and up/re-skilling are all within the range of possibilities to shape a unique and fulfilling career. If you're ready to take your career to the next level in a challenging international environment, focusing on continuous learning and dynamic teamwork, both locally as well as overseas, you're ready for Deloitte!

How you will Make an Impact

As an Audit Senior in the Audit & Assurance Team you are responsible for the accountable and proactive execution of assigned projects, aligning priorities and objectives in order to cater to clients’ needs.

Your main tasks will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Motivates and supports junior staff members to connect to ask technical questions and learn on-the-job and provides technical expertise for junior team members
  • Applies professional skepticism to identify what information is missing or incomplete and takes steps to obtain it
  • Review relevant literature and apply knowledge of business, financial accounting standards, and auditing standards as well as evaluating alternatives in the light of the relevant facts and circumstances, while demonstrating a commitment to quality and professional skepticism

Let’ s Talk About You

Your Leadership skills:

  • Monitors own results against objectives and seeks feedback to identify ways to enhance quality and personal/team performance 
  • Supports respect and inclusion by encouraging an open dialogue with colleagues and valuing individual differences and contributions
  • Builds their own understanding of emerging market trends and educates others accordingly 
  • Ability to communicate and interact effectively with staff at all organizational levels and ability to work on own initiative or as part of a team with minimal supervision.
  • Projects enthusiasm, optimism and commitment to their work and the teams they are part of.

Your Professional skills:

  • Applies tools and systematic approaches to gather and measure information/data from a variety of sources
  • Adapts to changing priorities as they arise and seeks guidance from team leaders.
  • Completes all training and other compliance obligations, including professional certifications, if applicable, on a timely basis
  • Evaluates problem(s) objectively considering facts, relevant professional standards or research, and develops a comprehensive picture of the problem
  • Strong commitment and proven record of professional and client service excellence.

Your Specialized skills:

  • Understands their responsibilities for performing risk assessment, refers to guidance, and appropriately documents their assessment of the risk(s) and planned audit responses
  • Proactively seeks to understand the wider audit timetable, including reviewing and reporting deadlines, and makes sure their work is ready for review on a timely basis
  • Delegating to junior team members, provide on the job training and provide feedback 
  • Candidates must be in possession of a university degree in Accountancy, or have completed or at an advanced stage of completing their ACCA or ACA professional qualification.
  • A minimum of two years of audit experience is required with a good knowledge of IFRS

Our Story

World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.

Our client-facing Audit & Assurance practice delivers audit, assurance and advisory services of the highest quality. Covering a wide range of industries and markets, be it financial services in multinational corporations to smaller, owner-managed businesses. Our distinctive audit approach and investment in technology enables our Audit & Assurance team to deliver seamless global accounting and auditing services. We are forward thinking, risk focused and insights based.

Why Deloitte?

As a Purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
  • Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents. 
  • Sponsored mental health support sessions through leading mental health services.
  • Weekly get-togethers.
  • Deloitte Communities to bring our people together and encourage work/life balance, social life and common interests.
  • Hybrid working flexibility subject to business requirements.
  • Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots. 
  • Renowned training programme with Deloitte University.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

title: Experienced Accounting & Reporting Assurance Public sector – Health Care
description_html:
Experienced Accounting & Reporting Assurance Public sector – Health Care   

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Accounting & Reporting Assurance avrai l’occasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Collaborando a diretto contatto con Manager e Partner, sarai responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualità del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realtà leader nel settore.

#YourRole

In quanto Consulente Senior avrai la possibilità di sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In particolare, ti occuperai di attività di consulenza tecnica a supporto della Direzione Aziendale della Stazione appaltante in ambito di progetti in corso nel settore Sanitario.

La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro strutturato e si occuperà di:

·       Supporto specialistico alle funzioni aziendali della stazione appaltante nell’ambito del Percorso Attuativo di Certificabilità in particolare fornendo un supporto specialistico all’area Amministrazione nell’ambito di procedure di analisi contabile e documentale.

·       Supporto alle funzioni aziendali della stazione appaltante nell’ambito delle attività di Internal Audit, in particolare fornendo un supporto specialistico nell’analisi degli attuali modelli in essere e sull’individuazione di eventuali gap per un piu efficace utilizzo e sviluppo del modello adottato;

·       Partecipare alle attività progettuali e produzione dei deliverable, collaborando nel coordinamento del gruppo di lavoro a diretto supporto del Responsabile del progetto;


Sede di lavoro: Roma e l’intero territorio della Regione Lazio


Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements

I candidati ideali sono in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

·       Laurea magistrale in discipline economiche (sarà considerato un valore aggiunto in percorsi e specializzazioni con focus in ambito sanitario);

·       3-7anni di esperienza in progetti in ambito amministrativo-contabile nel settore sanitario della Pubblica Amministrazione di cui almeno 1-2 anni di esperienza in progetti di revisione contabile in ambito anche privato.

·       Piena padronanza del pacchetto Ms Office (in particolare Excel, Power Point, word, Outlook)

#NiceToHave

Sarà criterio preferenziale la conoscenza relativa a tematiche di revisione dei conti in ambito ISA ITALIA ed argomenti amministrativo-contabili in ambito sanitario, quali a titolo esemplificativo:

-          Bilancio economico di previsione (BEP);

-          Bilancio d’esercizio;

-          Procedure amministrativo-contabili volte all'implementazione di un sistema di controllo interno;

-          Internal Audit e del Controllo di Gestione

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory, Tax & Legal e Technology & Transformation. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: Senior Client Accountant
description_html:
Tax - Business Process Solutions (BPS)

Client Accountants


Your Story

Are you a qualified accountant looking to take your career to the next level? Here at Deloitte, we recognize there is no one size fits all career path, and we offer opportunities to shape a unique and fulfilling journey.


How you will Make an Impact

As part of the BPS team, you will be responsible for updating and maintaining clients’ accounting records, amongst other responsibilities in order to help our clients excel globally.

Your main tasks will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Maintaining clients’ accounting records
  • Preparing periodic management accounts and other ad hoc management reporting
  • Preparing statutory financial statements under GAPSME/IFRS
  • Liaising with the company’s auditors and other service providers where applicable
  • Working closely with our specialist teams in VAT and Direct Tax compliance on matters impacting clients’ accounting records
  • Assist with drafting accounting reports and carrying out research in the accounting sphere.


Let’ s Talk About You

You are a qualified accountant with a Masters in Accountancy, ACCA or equivalent and have 1 – 2 years work experience in a similar position. Applicants in the final stages of their qualification will also be considered. You have strong knowledge of MS Office applications and are particularly Excel-savvy. You have excellent communication skills and a good command on English.

You support respect and inclusion by encouraging an open dialogue with colleagues and valuing individual differences and contributions. You project enthusiasm, optimism and commitment to your work and the team you are part of. You consult and proactively understand the needs of the client and work with them to develop relevant and valuable solutions.

This role has a strong career-building potential with many opportunities for personal growth and development. As is typical of any challenge, these roles require candidates with strong customer focus, keen attention to detail, and team playing characteristics coupled with strong communication skills and the ability to manage tasks and time effectively.


Ways to stand out:

Knowledge of related accounting software and ERP systems such as Dynamics 365 Business Central will be considered an asset.


Our Story
World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.

Our local Tax function comprises of approximately 120 professionals. In Tax, you will get the opportunity to provide clients with the support and advice they need to make key decisions on an international scale. We bring together a mix of commercial, industry and technical tax and regulatory knowledge, creative thinking and innovative technology, to help solve some of the most complex business issues our clients face. In this an ever-more high profile area, you’ll have the chance to understand how business, and your particular clients, really work.


Why Deloitte?
As a Purpose-led organization, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles that distinguish the Deloitte culture. We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energies you. We tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
  • Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents. 
  • Mental health support through sponsored therapy sessions. 
  • Hybrid working option.
  • Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots. 
  • Renowned training programme with Deloitte University.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

title: Quality Engineering Consultant / Senior Consultant
description_html:
Quality Engineering Consultant / Senior Consultant


What Impact will you make?


#YourOpportunity 

At Deloitte, the spirit of the excellence is part of our DNA. We strive to hire the brightest minds from all around the globe, allowing us to excel in both long-term strategic thinking and business improvement implementation as the undisputed global leader in professional services. We are committed to delivering impacting results for diverse private and public organization clients, linking our peerless talent in audit with unrivalled opportunities for impact – committing ourselves to sustainable growth and investment in our employees’ development and inclusion along the way. 


Our culture is rooted in profound shared values. Our values guide us as we live our purpose to serve our clients with quality and distinction, inspire our people to work collaboratively to deliver value, actively contribute to society, and lead the profession by challenging ourselves to do what matters most. Deloitte’s values are what unite us across cultures and geographies, and ultimately help us earn the trust and respect of our people, clients, and society. 


 We believe that our differences enable us to #makeanimpactthatmatters. 

 

#YourRole 


As a Quality Engineering Consultant / Senior Consultant, you will take a hands - on role in delivering high- quality testing services while actively supporting and guiding junior and entry - level QE team members. You will apply your solid knowledge of QA processes, test design, and execution to your own work, while also contributing to team effectiveness through coaching, collaboration, and promotion of consistent best practices. You will work closely with clients  to understand functional requirements and provide practical QA input, while supporting more senior roles from a functional and delivery perspective to ensure smooth execution of testing initiatives. 

During your tenure, your key responsibilities will involve:

  • Execute testing activities end to end, including test planning, test design, execution, defect management, and reporting.
  • Support and guide junior and entry - level QA team members in day - to - day testing activities through knowledge sharing, reviews, and hands - on assistance.
  • Collaborate with clients to understand requirements and propose practical, fit - for - purpose QA approaches to ensure quality outcomes.
  • Provide functional input and support to senior or managerial roles in implementing QA strategies, processes, and best practices across project. 
  • Contribute to the development and adoption of QA processes, methodologies, and standards to improve fficiency, constistency, and quality.
  • Ensure effective test execution, defect tracking, and clear communication of testing status and risks.
  • Identify improvement opportunities and support continuous enhancement of team capabilities.
  • Promote effective use of QA tools, frameworks, accelerators, and GenAI technologies to improve efficiency, accelerate defect detection ,and enhance overall quality delivery.
  • Monitor and ensure effective test planning, execution, defect management, and reporting.
  • Identify areas for improvement, drive adoption of best practices, and support the continuous development of team capabilities. 
  • Promote efficient use of QA tools, frameworks, accelerators, and GenAI technologies to support testing activities, improve efficiency, accelerate defect detection, and enhance overall quality delivery.

#WinningRequirements 

To qualify for the role, you must have: 

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 
  • 3 - 5 years of experience in Quality Engineering, with hands-on experience in testing (manual and/or automation), or in business analysis. 
  • Solid understanding of QA processes, testing methodologies and tools. 
  • Experience working directly with clients, with the ability to communicate functional QA recommendations clearly and effectively.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively within a team and support less experienced colleagues. 
  • Strong problem - solving skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking ability.
  • ISTQB Foundation Level certification (considered a plus).
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable.


#AboutTechnology&Transformation

Six core competency areas make up our Technology & Transformation service line:

  • Cyber;
  • Engineering, AI & Data;
  • Enterprise, Technology & Performance;
  • Finance Transformation;
  • Deloitte Digital;
  • Human Capital.

We exist to solve complex problems

Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Consulting team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact. 

We are committed to collaboration

Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge.  In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities. 

We create long-term, sustainable impact

We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come. 


WHY DELOITTE

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.


ABOUT DELOITTE

Our services

Deloitte operates in Greece since 1975, as a member of one of the world’s largest professional services networks, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu. With offices in Athens, Thessaloniki, Heraklion, Patras and Ioannina, Deloitte Greece employs more than 2,900 professionals.

After 50 years of successful and dynamic presence in the Greek market, we bring an unmatched breadth and depth of expertise across audit and assurance, technology & transformation, tax & legal and strategy, risk & transactions advisory services. Operating in a multidisciplinary model enables us to draw from a pool of world-class talent, identifying the ideal skillset for each project, and to collaborate across businesses, to solve the toughest, most challenging issues of our clients. It is with them that we have built a trusted relationship, by delivering innovative solutions and utilizing state-of-the-art tools and technologies across all industries- Consumer Products, Energy Resources & Industrials, Financial Services, Life Sciences & Health Care, Government & Public Services, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.


Our Purpose

Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.


Our values

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism.

We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.


Our talent experience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.


Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Quality Engineering Consultant / Senior Consultant
What Impact will you make?
#YourOpportunity
At Deloitte, the
spirit of the excellence
is part of our DNA. We strive to hire the
brightest minds from all around the globe
, allowing us to excel in both long-term strategic thinking and business improvement implementation as the undisputed global leader in professional services. We are committed to
delivering impacting results
for diverse private and public organization clients, linking our peerless talent in audit with
unrivalled opportunities for impact
– committing ourselves to sustainable growth and investment in our employees’ development and inclusion along the way.
Our culture is rooted in profound shared values. Our values guide us as we live our purpose to serve our clients with quality and distinction, inspire our people to work collaboratively to deliver value, actively contribute to society, and lead the profession by challenging ourselves to do what matters most.
Deloitte’s values are what unite us
across cultures and geographies, and ultimately help us earn the trust and respect of our people, clients, and society.
We believe that our differences enable us to
#makeanimpactthatmatters.
#YourRole
As a Quality Engineering Consultant / Senior Consultant, you will take a hands - on role in delivering high- quality testing services while actively supporting and guiding junior and entry - level QE team members. You will apply your solid knowledge of QA processes, test design, and execution to your own work, while also contributing to team effectiveness through coaching, collaboration, and promotion of consistent best practices. You will work closely with clients  to understand functional requirements and provide practical QA input, while supporting more senior roles from a functional and delivery perspective to ensure smooth execution of testing initiatives.
During your tenure, your key responsibilities will involve:
Execute testing activities end to end, including test planning, test design, execution, defect management, and reporting.
Support and guide junior and entry - level QA team members in day - to - day testing activities through knowledge sharing, reviews, and hands - on assistance.
Collaborate with clients to understand requirements and propose practical, fit - for - purpose QA approaches to ensure quality outcomes.
Provide functional input and support to senior or managerial roles in implementing QA strategies, processes, and best practices across project.
Contribute to the development and adoption of QA processes, methodologies, and standards to improve fficiency, constistency, and quality.
Ensure effective test execution, defect tracking, and clear communication of testing status and risks.
Identify improvement opportunities and support continuous enhancement of team capabilities.
Promote effective use of QA tools, frameworks, accelerators, and GenAI technologies to improve efficiency, accelerate defect detection ,and enhance overall quality delivery.
Monitor and ensure effective test planning, execution, defect management, and reporting.
Identify areas for improvement, drive adoption of best practices, and support the continuous development of team capabilities.
Promote efficient use of QA tools, frameworks, accelerators, and GenAI technologies to support testing activities, improve efficiency, accelerate defect detection, and enhance overall quality delivery.
#WinningRequirements
To qualify for the role, you must have:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
3 - 5 years of experience in Quality Engineering, with hands-on experience in testing (manual and/or automation), or in business analysis.
Solid understanding of QA processes, testing methodologies and tools.
Experience working directly with clients, with the ability to communicate functional QA recommendations clearly and effectively.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively within a team and support less experienced colleagues.
Strong problem - solving skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking ability.
ISTQB Foundation Level certification (considered a plus).
Military obligations fulfilled where applicable.
#AboutTechnology&Transformation
Six core competency areas make up our Technology & Transformation service line:
Cyber;
Engineering, AI & Data;
Enterprise, Technology & Performance;
Finance Transformation;
Deloitte Digital;
Human Capital.
We exist to solve complex problems
Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Consulting team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.
We are committed to collaboration
Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge.  In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.
We create long-term, sustainable impact
We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.
WHY DELOITTE
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
ABOUT DELOITTE
Our services
Deloitte operates in Greece since 1975, as a member of one of the world’s largest professional services networks, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu. With offices in Athens, Thessaloniki, Heraklion, Patras and Ioannina, Deloitte Greece employs more than 2,900 professionals.
After 50 years of successful and dynamic presence in the Greek market, we bring an unmatched breadth and depth of expertise across audit and assurance, technology & transformation, tax & legal and strategy, risk & transactions advisory services. Operating in a multidisciplinary model enables us to draw from a pool of world-class talent, identifying the ideal skillset for each project, and to collaborate across businesses, to solve the toughest, most challenging issues of our clients. It is with them that we have built a trusted relationship, by delivering innovative solutions and utilizing state-of-the-art tools and technologies across all industries- Consumer Products, Energy Resources & Industrials, Financial Services, Life Sciences & Health Care, Government & Public Services, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.
Our Purpose
Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
Our values
At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism.
We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.
Our talent experience
From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.
Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

title: Experienced - HR Strategy & Technology - NextHub Bari
description_html:
Experienced - HR Transformation - NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando una figura consultant/senior consultant da inserire nel team HR Transformation di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.
Il business HR Transformation di NextHub si occupa di migliorare le prestazioni delle soluzioni Global di HR Technology Transformation che vanno oltre la tecnologia e danno valore aggiunto ai nostri clienti nel trasformare, innovare e digitalizzare i loro processi HR.
 
Your Role

La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:

  • Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni dei colleghi e del cliente, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
  • Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo e strutturando dati e svolgendo analisi a supporto delle decisioni di business
  • Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team
  • Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali

Winning Requirements

  • Diploma o Laurea con indirizzo Economia, Ingegneria;
  • Interesse ad essere inseriti in un contesto consulenziale a contatto e per supporto dei propri colleghi che, a loro volta, si interfacceranno direttamente con i clienti; 
  • Esperienza di almeno 2 anni su temi di HR Transformation;
  • Spiccato interesse e conoscenza del perimetro HR e di progetti di implementazioni applicative su gestionali SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM, Service Now HR o Concur;
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.

To Make An Impact That Matters


Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.
In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.
In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 
Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

description_html:
YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Ricerchiamo per la sede di Genova, giovani laureandi/e e/o neolaureati/e in materie economiche che saranno coinvolti/e nelle attività del team.

La risorsa sarà inserita nel team Global Investment and Innovation Incentives (Gi3). Il team offre servizi completi in materia di incentivi governativi per la realizzazione di progetti in settori quali lo sviluppo tecnologico, l’efficienza energetica, l’ambiente, l’innovazione, la sostenibilità e la formazione.

L’attività principale della risorsa sarà il supporto al responsabile nazionale della service line Gi3 e dei diversi team locali nelle seguenti attività:

- predisposizione delle offering per i clienti e di altro materiale commerciale e informativo;

- attività di comunicazione interna (preparazione di materiali utili per presentazioni, convegni, ecc.);

- supporto e coordinamento nell’organizzazione delle attività fra i diversi team a livello nazionale;

In aggiunta, la risorsa sarà impegnata a supporto delle attività ordinarie del team, quali l’individuazione di nuove opportunità di finanziamento e nelle attività propedeutiche all’accesso e alla rendicontazione degli incentivi.

Si offre Stage di 6 mesi iniziali.


WINNING REQUIREMENTS

Desideriamo entrare in contatto con canditati/e che abbiano:

- una laurea in discipline economico/giuridiche;

- una solida conoscenza del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel, Power Point);

- ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;

- buone capacità relazionali e comunicative;

- ottime doti organizzative.


Si offre:


• ambiente giovane e dinamico;

• contesto internazionale;

• possibilità di smart working.

ABOUT STUDIO TRIBUTARIO E SOCIETARIO

Lo Studio Tributario e Societario, Società tra Professionisti dedicata alla consulenza ed assistenza fiscale ad imprese e gruppi italiani ed internazionali, facente parte del network Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu, è presente in Italia con sedi a Milano, Roma, Firenze, Torino, Genova, Bologna, Padova, Napoli e Catania. Lo Studio offre consulenza ed assistenza fiscale e tributaria nei diversi settori di specializzazione con scrupolosa attenzione agli aspetti tecnici, forte impegno verso la qualità e continuo riferimento alle esigenze del cliente.

MAKE AN IMPACT THAT MATTERS

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: Junior - Capital Markets, Transaction Accounting Support –Assurance
description_html:
Junior - Capital Markets, Transaction Accounting Support –Assurance

Sei pronto a crescere insieme al team Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Accounting & Reporting Assurance avrai l’occasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

In particolare, collaborando con il tuo Team, avrai l’opportunità di essere al centro delle operazioni sui mercati dei capitali, supportando le società nell’ambito di IPO, emissioni di Bond, transazioni di M&A e tutte le operazioni regolamentate sui mercati finanziari, come specialista Assurance del team di revisione che presta servizio al cliente oppure come Advisor nell’operazione.

Nello specifico:

  • Assistere i clienti a navigare con successo nel processo di offerta, attraverso la revisione e la redazione dei documenti di offerta;
  • Fornire consulenza su questioni tecniche complesse nell’ambito dei principi contabili IFRS o dei principi contabili nazionali;
  • Sviluppare e fornire formazione interna ed esterna, ai team di revisione nonché a clienti potenziali ed esistenti, sui principi contabili IFRS, sul Regolamento Prospetti UE, SEC Reporting Manual, linee guida ESMA, CONSOB, o di altre autorità di vigilanza e prassi di settore;
  • Interfacciarsi con gli altri attori coinvolti nella transazione (funzionari della società cliente, studi legali, investment bankers, team di revisione e altri advisors);
  • Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team;
  • Collaborare efficacemente in team internazionali ed eterogenei per specializzazione.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realtà leader nel settore.

#YourRole

I candidati e le candidate parteciperanno ad un percorso di selezione nel quale avranno la possibilità di mettersi alla prova attraverso giornate di assessment, con l’obiettivo di valorizzare competenze e potenzialità personali.

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilità di imparare dai colleghi più Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali.

Conoscerti ci permetterà di aiutarti a trovare la strada giusta per la tua carriera scegliendo percorsi di formazione e crescita professionale: con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe più esperte, sarai responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualità del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics. 

Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano.

#WinningRequirements

·       Laureando/neolaureato in Economia o ingegneria gestionale (preferenziale)

·       Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese

·       Conoscenza dei principi di revisione

·       Padronanza dei principali strumenti informatici

·       Attitudine al teamwork, al problem solving e spiccate capacità di analisi

·       Altamente motivato a crescere e svilupparsi professionalmente

·       Dinamicità e attitudine alla professione del consulente

·       Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all'estero

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory, Tax & Legal e Technology & Transformation. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: Junior - Functional Analyst - NextHub Bari
description_html:
Junior - Functional Analyst - NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire all’interno di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.
Il nostro Hub ha l'obiettivo di fornire ai giovani e a tutti i professionisti solide competenze nella trasformazione digitale del Paese e in particolare nel Mezzogiorno. 

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:
  • Interpretare proattivamente le richieste dei colleghi, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
  • Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo e strutturando dati e svolgendo analisi a supporto dei colleghi
  • Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team
  • Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale/magistrale in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica, o lauree STEM (conseguita o a 5/6 mesi dal conseguimento)
  • Spiccata capacità di analisi dei dati, sensibilità al business, gestione della complessità e attitudine verso la tecnologia
  • Conoscenza di Microsoft Office con un focus particolare su Excel e Power Point
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Disponibilità a trasferte in Italia e all’estero

To Make An Impact That Matters


Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

description_html:
Deloitte Audit & Assurance – Junior IT Audit & Assurance

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team IT & Specialized Assurance di Deloitte Audit & Assurance nelle sedi di Milano, Torino e Padova che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid (in smart working, dal cliente e in ufficio).

Il business di IT Audit & Assurance si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nell'individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti dalla Funzione IT, anche con il supporto di tecnologie innovative.

Entrando nel Team avrai l'occasione di crescere e sviluppare forte competenze su tematiche multidisciplinari quali “IT Audit, Risk Analysis, Compliance Management, IT Governance e IT Security.

Sarai coinvolto nel supporto delle attività di assistenza al CEO, CIO e/o CISO dell’azienda nel migliorare la profittabilità e raggiungere l’eccellenza operativa della funzione IT.

  • Raccogliere ed analizzare le informazioni a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti.
  • Collaborare con il Team di progetto in modo proattivo e collaborativo per il raggiungimento dell’obiettivo comune.

 

                              #WinningRequirements

  • Laurea in ingegneria, informatica o statistica (completata oppure a 5/6 mesi dal conseguimento).
  • Forte interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l'ambito IT.
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata).
  • Disponibilità a trasferte in caso di esigenza.
