title: Government & Public Sector Senior Consultant
description_html:
Government & Public Sector Senior Consultant


What Impact will you make?


#YourOpportunity

Deloitte is proud to be named the no. 1 consulting service provider in the world by Gartner and the most valuable and strongest commercial services brand in the world by Brand Finance.

We are delivering business advisory and technology-enabled business transformations across the globe, always with a focus to our vision: to make an impact that matters. Within Deloitte, the Engineering, AI & Data team focuses on delivering trusted high-end technology advisory services.

Under this framework, we are currently looking for an enthusiastic Government & Public Sector Senior Consultant to become part of our dynamic Technology & Transformation team in our offices in Athens. In this role, you’ll work within a team to help clients transform their technology platforms and business operations. Partnering with some of the world’s largest organizations, you’ll help COO’s, CFO’s, CIO’s and their teams realize their ambitions – from improving financial performance, to accelerating speed to market and delivering continuous innovation.

Our diverse and passionate team is encouraged to use agile techniques in the development, delivery and on-going management of software solutions that solve complex business issues.

At Deloitte, you will offer solutions for our customers’ challenges, while subsequently working on your own career and personal growth ambitions. You’ll learn and develop a mix of advisory and technology skills that will help you define effective strategies and put them into action. Collaboration will sit at the heart of everything you do, as you work closely with both colleagues and clients to deliver projects that drive businesses forward. Together we’ll help to imagine and deliver solutions that prepare organizations for the future — overcoming new challenges and embracing the opportunities that come with advances in technology during this new digital age.

#YourRole

Your role as a Government & Public Sector Senior Consultant will focus on the delivery of client engagements, by understanding objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning your own work to objectives and setting personal priorities, teaming with others across businesses and borders and taking accountability for own and team results.

In this role, you will build relationships and exercise your communication skills in order to positively influence your peers and other stakeholders. You will commit to personal learning and development by actively seeking opportunities for growth, you will share knowledge and experience with others, and act as a strong brand ambassador, embracing our purpose and values in order to put these into practice in your professional life.

During your tenure as a Government & Public Sector Senior Consultant, you will demonstrate and develop your ability to:

  • Analyze and document the client’s current state process designs by using business process management techniques (e.g. BPMN, RACI, SIPOC, VSM, etc.);
  • Identify and document any pain points/quality issues/inefficiencies/non-value-adding activities leading to poor performance;
  • Define the process efficiency metrics (KPIs) and the appropriate SLAs;
  • Generate business requirement documents for key process improvement projects;
  • Effectively monitor project and program implementation;
  • Analyze business requirements and prepare technical and functional specifications and develop tender documents;
  • Manage and deliver projects and proposals;
  • Deal with project research and participate in report writing process;
  • Effectively interact with colleagues and clients of varying backgrounds to effectively serve clients.


#WinningRequirements

To qualify for the role you must have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Public Policy, International Studies, Economics, Business Administration, Finance or Engineering;
  • Master’s Degree in Business Administration (MBA) or similar will be considered as a plus;
  • Between 3 - 5 years of relevant work experience in a consulting firm or related professional area with emphasis on providing advisory services to public sector organizations;
  • Knowledge and prior experience in areas related to Government and Public Sector Services gained through serving Greek public administration, European Institutions and / or International Donor Organizations across multiple policy areas;
  • Prior experience in preparation of responses to Greek public sector and European tenders will be considered as a plus;
  • Understanding of the latest trends across various policy areas (e.g., general public services, economic affairs, environmental protection, social policies), along with insights into major planned Greek public sector reforms and the funding or financing opportunities available for their implementation;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to develop insights from quantitative and qualitative information;
  • Experience in management of co-funded projects will be considered as a plus;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to prioritize and handle multiple assignments;
  • Strong oral and written Greek & English language communication skills;
  • Computer literacy;
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable.

#AboutTechnology&Transformation 

Six core competency areas make up our Technology & Transformation service line:

  • Cyber;
  • Engineering, AI & Data;
  • Enterprise, Technology & Performance;
  • Finance Transformation
  • Customer;
  • Human Capital.

We exist to solve complex problems

Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Technology & Transformation team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.

We are committed to collaboration

Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge.  In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.

We create long-term, sustainable impact  

We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.


WHY DELOITTE

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

ABOUT DELOITTE

Our services

Deloitte operates in Greece since 1975, as a member of one of the world’s largest professional services networks, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu. With offices in Athens, Thessaloniki, Heraklion, Patras and Ioannina, Deloitte Greece employs more than 2,900 professionals.

After 50 years of successful and dynamic presence in the Greek market, we bring an unmatched breadth and depth of expertise across audit and assurance, technology & transformation, tax & legal and strategy, risk & transactions advisory services. Operating in a multidisciplinary model enables us to draw from a pool of world-class talent, identifying the ideal skillset for each project, and to collaborate across businesses, to solve the toughest, most challenging issues of our clients. It is with them that we have built a trusted relationship, by delivering innovative solutions and utilizing state-of-the-art tools and technologies across all industries- Consumer Products, Energy Resources & Industrials, Financial Services, Life Sciences & Health Care, Government & Public Services, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.

Our Purpose

Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.

Our values

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism.

We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.

Our talent experience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.


Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

title: Junior Associate – Legal – Legal Services | Employment & Social Security Law
description_html:
Junior Associate – Legal – Legal Services | Employment & Social Security Law

What Impact will you make?

YOUR OPPORTUNITY

Koimtzoglou-Bakalis-Venieris-Leventis & Associates Law Partnership ("KBVL Law Firm"), the Greek member of Deloitte Legal Network is currently looking for a brilliant lawyer (Associate) with a focus in employment and social security law and civil litigation proceedings to join its dynamic and highly motivating legal practice in Athens.

As a member of our busy and expanding team, you will work with a diverse client portfolio and contribute to large-scale projects in employment and social security law. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to engage in corporate work, mergers and acquisitions, and complex commercial matters.

This position offers a unique opportunity to grow professionally in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Your role as an associate, your role will focus on delivering client engagements by understanding expectations, maintaining accountability for performance, and fostering strong communication and relationship-building skills. You will also contribute to team and business priorities while committing to personal learning and development, seizing opportunities to make a meaningful impact through exceptional client service.

In this role, you will also have the opportunity to contribute to shaping innovative legal strategies, collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, and mentoring junior team members, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.

During your tenure as an Associate, you will demonstrate and further develop your ability to:

  • Provide innovative legal solutions to complex commercial and employment law issues, ensuring a superior client experience;
  • Provide litigation support in relation to complex commercial and employment law matters before Greek courts, drafting and negotiating; documentation relating to out-of-court settlement;
  • Deepen your expertise in current labour legislation applicable to a wide range of industries;
  • Leverage advanced tools and technologies, collaborating with non-legal functions to enhance the reach and effectiveness of your legal advice;
  • Take on leadership responsibilities by managing aspects of client engagements and supporting team development initiatives.

This role offers a unique opportunity to grow professionally in a challenging and dynamic environment while playing a key role in delivering impactful legal solutions.

OUR REQUIREMENTS

Our ideal candidate is a young, bright and ambitious lawyer that focuses on delivering work of high quality, commits to high levels of client service and has ability to build strong relationships. We expect that you also have strong interpersonal and organizational skills and the ability to work effectively within a team.

In particular, to qualify for the role you must have:

  • Qualified as an Attorney-at-Law in Greece (Athens Bar Association or other Bar Association membership);
  • A Master of Laws (LL.M.) or equivalent postgraduate qualification from a prominent, well-acclaimed University in Greece or abroad;
  • Two (2) to five (5) years of post-qualification work experience at a law firm, law office or in-house;
  • Prior work experience or a proven interest in employment and social security law and civil litigation proceedings;
  • An excellent command of the English language;
  • A professional approach, commercial awareness and strong communication skills;
  • Computer literacy.

Preferred skills:
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.

ABOUT DELOITTE LEGAL

Deloitte member firms have a long standing reputation for helping clients to address complex, cross border issues. Skilled and experienced Deloitte Legal lawyers work together with other Deloitte professionals in tax, consulting, and financial advisory to guide clients through their projects in a coordinated way around the world. Deloitte Legal is able to provide holistic guidance around strategic business decisions as well as offer support services that can increase efficiency and reduce the cost of some routine legal activities.

Deloitte Legal is one of only a few truly global legal service providers. With more than 1,750 professionals in more than 75 countries we comprise one of the top 5 business law practices in Continental Europe and have substantial operations elsewhere in the world.

Deloitte Legal is focused on helping clients to take action today to achieve their business objectives tomorrow.

Koimtzoglou-Bakalis-Venieris-Leventis & Associates Law Partnership ("KBVL Law Firm") is a Greek law partnership regulated by Presidential Decree 81/2005 and Law 4194/2013, as currently in force. It is a registered legal entity member of the Athens Bar Association and is qualified to provide legal services and Greek law advice. KBVL Law Firm is also the sole Greek member of Deloitte Legal, an international network of law firms.

© 2025 For information, contact KBVL Law Firm

description_html:
Junior - Indirect Procurement - NextHub Bari


Your Role

  • Supporto al Category Management 
  • Assistenza nella gestione strategica delle categorie di acquisti comprese quelle relative a progetti, strutture, gestione della flotta e procurement core (e le attività correlate). Questo include aspetti transazionali e la gestione dei fornitori.

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale o magistrale in Economia o similari
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese sia scritta che parlata;
  • Buona conoscenza del funzionamento di Excel e Powerpoint
  • Approccio analitico e capacità di elaborare le informazioni con precisione

To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

description_html:
Junior Finance & Accounting Analyst 

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Finance & Accounting di Deloitte Business Solution nelle sedi di Milano e Bologna, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Finance & Accounting (F&A) è specializzata nel fornire un supporto operativo a 360° in tutte quelle attività che coinvolgono il CFO e la Finance Function delle aziende clienti, quali ad esempio contabilità generale e bilancio, controllo di gestione, compliance fiscale, regulatory reporting, gestione dei processi amministrativi relativi al ciclo attivo e passivo, supporto in situazioni straordinarie, atipiche, di trasformazione e di discontinuità aziendale (Merge&Acquisition, Carve Out, evoluzione delle strutture organizzative e dei sistemi informativi, dei processi e procedure), supporto nella sostituzione/integrazione della struttura e delle unità organizzative, progetti di data cleaning e reconciliation.

 

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:

  • verifica e calcolo degli stanziamenti mensili
  • predisposizione delle scritture di rettifica/integrazione, assestamento/ accertamento
  • redazione di bilanci di esercizio/separati e di bilanci consolidati
  • preparazione del reporting mensile o trimestrale secondo diversi criteri contabili (IFRS, US GAAP, principi di gruppo ecc.)

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea magistrale in materie economiche
  • Conoscenza dei principi contabili nazionali ed internazionali (IFRS), della normativa fiscale in materia di imposte dirette ed indiretta

title: EU Account Consultant @Thessaloniki
description_html:
What Impact will you make?

Are you looking for an opportunity in Thessaloniki that offers you a hybrid working model?

Are you ready to work on large scale projects for industry-leading clients around the world and elevate your career to an international level?

If so, check below for more info about this career opportunity!

 

#YourOpportunity

Deloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Since 2018, Deloitte has been operating its Competence Center in Thessaloniki with satellites in the cities of Patras, Heraklion, and Ioannina - which are model hubs of expertise, training, and innovation, specializing in cutting-edge exponential technologies, in which graduates and young professionals undergo immersive experiences, continuous learning, gaining practical insights and hands-on training that empower them to navigate the complexities of the digital landscape.

 Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team.

We are currently seeking for ambitious team players to become part of our EU Account, within our Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory business unit in Thessaloniki.

#YourServiceLine 

Strategy, Risk & Transactions (SR&T) Advisory

Strategy, Risk & Transactions (SR&T) is an end-to-end strategic advisory practice, enabling our C-suite clients to make informed, robust decisions and strategic choices. It integrates the full scale of Deloitte's M&A capabilities, consolidates Climate & Sustainability advisory capabilities, and tightens the connection between strategy development and risk management to assist clients with navigating uncertainty and change.

#AboutYourRole

As an EU Account Consultant, you will focus on proposals, contracts and procurement support. You will:


FwC templates and guidelines

·       Support senior staff in drafting and keeping up-to-date of proposal templates, FwC guidelines and handbooks

Archiving and Reporting

·       Archive all requests, proposals and contracts (SharePoint)

·       Manage the FwC internal report and keep it up-to-date

·       FwC progress reports support – support senior staff with data collection for monthly/quarterly reports on FwC progress towards the client

·       Monitor deadlines for the submission of FwC progress reports and remind team members about these deadlines (timeline depending on the FWC

Stakeholder Management support

·       Ensure a good relationship with the client: e.g. by following up on issues related to the ordering process

·       Ensure a good relationship with the consortium partners and subcontractors

·       Ensure a good relationship with member firms and project managers of all BUs/Offerings

·       FwC onboarding calls for PMs: set FwC onboarding calls/meetings to introduce the FwC and process to the bid teams

·       Provide access to SharePoint and manage the site

FwC Meetings support

·       Assist with the preparation of presentations and reports for FwC regular meetings (with member firms, consortium partners, subcontractors)

·       Take minutes during the meetings and distribute them to the participants

Requests Management

·       Manage the FwC functional mailbox

·       Monitor the reception of requests under the FwC and dispatch them in a timely manner

·       Monitor the request qualification process, reminding team members about deadlines

·       Proactively inform senior staff about risks and issues regarding deadlines

·       Send/receive clarification requests to/from the client and dispatch them to the respective team in a timely manner

·       Register new opportunities identified by PMs in the FwC pipeline

Proposal process and compliance review

·       Provide proposal templates and inform the bid team of the FwC and internal deadlines and requirements

·       Monitor the proposal preparation process and compliance with set deadlines -> escalate to senior staff if deadlines are not met

·       Review proposals against the FwC requirements

·       Submit proposals within set deadlines using the applicable client means (Supplier Portal, Email)

Contract Signature

·       Coordinate the signature of contracts, their amendments and extensions, signature of declarations on pre-existing rights, NDAs, and any other document, if necessary

#OurRequirements

Your Profile

  • Excellent academic credentials for both undergraduate and graduate coursework.
  • MSc degree ideally in economics, business, project management but not mandatory.
  • EU related experience with focus on contracts and proposals will be appreciated.
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Fluency in English; knowledge of French and/or Dutch is an asset.
  • Technology Affinity: Basic understanding of core tech concepts (infrastructure, cloud, app development, ERP/COTS) and how tech projects are delivered. Curious and comfortable learning about our Global Storefront and areas like AI, cloud engineering, and data management.
  • Previous knowledge of European policies will be valued.


Personal Qualities Valued:

  • Intellectual power and agility: curious, rigorous, and creative.
  • Analytical mindset: demonstrating strong analytical skills.
  • Strong communication: ability to articulate complex ideas to all levels of an organization.
  • Confidence in the face of challenges: comfortable with working on difficult issues where there can be no definitive “right” answer; patient in the face of uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity.
  • Time management: capable of working on multiple, overlapping tasks in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proactivity: able to take initiative and make things happen under moderate supervision and guidance.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level in a challenging international environment, focusing on continuous learning and dynamic teamwork, both in Greece and abroad, you're ready for Deloitte!

#WhatWeOffer

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits:

🏠 Modern hybrid workplace, characterized by flexibility and Smart Working

⚖ Empowered well-being: We provide multiple program offerings to support your well-being needs (flexible working arrangements, extra days of leave, parental allowances)

🌍 Engagement within international large-scale teams and projects, with opportunities to travel for training or client purposes.

📚 Constant opportunities for learning with unlimited access to internal and external learning platforms and sponsored certificates aligned with business needs and technology trends

🚀 Challenging and innovating environment where personal development and growth are encouraged, always with transparency and trust

🌈Diverse culture and active communities that enable you to bring yourself to work

🎉 Team Building and Corporate Social Responsibility Activities

🏃 A buddy to support you with your onboarding

🌴 Extra days of annual leave

 ⚕ Private medical health insurance plan

💳 Ticket restaurant card

🛍️ Exclusive Discounts to several retail providers, restaurants and others

📱 Mobile phone

🍏 Fresh fruits and unlimited coffee everyday at our offices

Please note that all the well-being benefits mentioned above are subject to annual review 

About Deloitte

#OurServices

Deloitte offers integrated services that include Audit & Assurance, Tax and Legal, Strategy-Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Italy and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.

#OurPurpose

We are led by a purpose, to make an impact that matters with clients, people and society. This purpose defines who we are and what we stand for. It's not about being the biggest. It’s about being the first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.

#OurValues

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.

#OurTalentExperience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the center of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.

title: Citrix Subject Matter Expert @ Thessaloniki
description_html:
Are you looking for an opportunity in Thessaloniki that offers you a hybrid working model? 


Are you ready to work on large scale projects for industry-leading clients around the world and elevate your career to an international level?  


If so, check below for more info about this career opportunity!  


You bring passion, we bring opportunities!  

 

#YourOpportunity  


Deloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Since 2018, Deloitte has been operating its Alexander Competence Center in Thessaloniki with satellites in the cities of Patras, Heraklion, and Ioannina - which are model hubs of expertise, training, and innovation, specializing in cutting-edge exponential technologies, in which graduates and young professionals undergo immersive experiences, continuous learning, gaining practical insights and hands-on training that empower them to navigate the complexities of the digital landscape.  
 
Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team.  

#AboutYourTeam


We are a small team of Technology enthusiasts working to ensure our staff have the best possible VDI experience. Our Citrix Cloud platform has up to 4500 individual users a day, many completing their full working day remotely via VDI. Ensuring we have a well optimized VDI platform so that they can have a productive the day is our top priority.

#AboutYourRole 

Advanced Incident Triage & Technical Resolution:

  • Perform in-depth diagnosis of complex Citrix Cloud and virtual workspace issues.
  • Lead investigations involving Cloud Connectors, VDAs, identity integration, networking, and authentication flows.
  • Resolve incidents escalated from Level 1/2 or Global TOC.
  • Apply workarounds and long-term fixes for service degradation or outages.


Major Incident Management Support (MIM):

  • Act as technical lead during P1/P2 incidents.
  • Provide real-time guidance for incident bridges.
  • Deliver impact assessment and recovery actions.
  • Escalate to Citrix vendor support when platform bugs or service faults are suspected.


On-Call & Escalation Handling:

  • Act as an escalation point for out-of-hours critical issues.
  • Respond to urgent operational alerts or system failures.
  • Collaborate with Global TOC to ensure rapid escalation handling.


Configuration, Change & Cloud Platform Maintenance:

  • Implement advanced configuration updates relating to Citrix Cloud services.
  • Validate and support platform upgrades, integrations, or feature enablement.
  • Advise on architectural improvements and best practice compliance.


Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Problem Management:

  • Perform post-incident technical analysis.
  • Lead or support RCA reporting and corrective action planning.
  • Maintain technical documentation, runbooks, and knowledge base.


Platform Reliability & Continuous Improvement:

  • Monitor and optimize Citrix Cloud performance and availability.
  • Recommend resilience and recovery enhancements.
  • Ensure designs adhere to compliance (e.g., data residency, GDPR, CxO security standards).


Vendor & Internal Stakeholder Collaboration:

  • Liaise with Citrix technical support and engineering (TAM/Priority Support).
  • Work closely with Global TOC, infrastructure teams, identity/security services, and network operations.
  • Support service owner in roadmap planning and platform lifecycle.


Continuous Service Improvement:

  • Contribute to the team's roadmap for specific improvements to the NSE VDI Service, including network optimisation, BCP/DR readiness, cost optimisation, continuous training for L3 and L1 teams, and ongoing upskilling to maintain optimal service performance.

#RequiredSkills

  • Expertise in Citrix technologies (CVAD, PVS, Citrix Cloud), FSLogix, cloud platforms (Azure, AWS), Entra ID, Azure Virtual Desktop, Active Directory, Microsoft Intune, PowerShell, and ITIL-based 3rd line support.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field
  • Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.

#PreferedQualifications: 

  • Knowledge of ITIL framework, Azure certifications (AZ900, AZ104), automation/scripting, system development for VDI endpoints, and disaster recovery documentation.

#WhatWeOffer

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits: 

 

🏠 Modern hybrid workplace, characterized by flexibility and Smart Working 

⚖ Empowered well-being: We provide multiple program offerings to support your well-being needs (flexible working arrangements, extra days of leave, parental allowances) 

🌍 Engagement within international large-scale teams and projects, with opportunities to travel for training or client purposes. 

📚 Constant opportunities for learning with unlimited access to internal and external learning platforms and sponsored certificates aligned with business needs and technology trends 

🚀 Challenging and innovating environment where personal development and growth are encouraged, always with transparency and trust 

🌈 Diverse culture and active communities that enable you to bring yourself to work 

🎉 Team Building and Corporate Social Responsibility Activities 

🏃 A buddy to support you with your onboarding 

🌴 Extra days of annual leave 

 ⚕   Private medical health insurance plan 

💳 Ticket restaurant card 

🏷  Exclusive Discounts to several retail providers, restaurants and others 

📱 Mobile phone 

🍏 Fresh fruits and unlimited coffee everyday at our offices 

 

*Please note that all the well-being benefits mentioned above are subject to annual review

 

About Deloitte 

#OurServices 
Deloitte offers integrated services that include Audit, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax and Legal. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Italy and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within. 
  
#OurPurpose 
We are led by a purpose, to make an impact that matters with clients, people and society. This purpose defines who we are and what we stand for. It's not about being the biggest. It’s about being the first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent. 
  
#OurValues 
At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture. 
  
#OurTalentExperience 
From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the center of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day. 

Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now! 

Location: Thessaloniki

title: Manager Up - SAP Supply Chain
description_html:
Manager Up – SAP Supply Chain 

Stiamo cercando una figura Manager/ Senior Manager da inserire nel team SAP di Deloitte Consulting nella sede di Milano, Roma, Torino, Napoli, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid. 
Il business SAP di Deloitte Consulting si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

Entrando nel Team SAP avrai l’occasione di utilizzare la tecnologia e la conoscenza dei processi per supportare le aziende nei loro percorsi di trasformazione digitale basati sull’implementazione di soluzioni SAP.

Lavoriamo su progetti cross industry, dal food&beverage, al retail & grocery, automotive, fashion & luxury, FSI,e molto altro, spaziando da progetti nazionali a quelli internazionali, collaborando con altre member firm Deloitte.

Il nostro team interviene quando è il momento di re-immaginare i processi di business, tenendo in considerazione anche i dati, i customer insight, le operation, la forza lavoro, i mercati.


Your Role

Il Manager/Senior Manager ricoprirà un ruolo strategico: guidando un team, condividendo il suo know-how e approccio, sarà responsabile delle relazioni con il cliente favorendo lo sviluppo del business occupandosi di:

  • Condurre e gestire progetti, identificando, valutando e progettando le migliori architetture e soluzioni dimostrando eccellenza operativa, visione e pensiero strategico
  • Affrontare e risolvere le sfide tecnologiche dei clienti in modo innovativo ed efficace
  • Impegnarsi con gli stakeholder interni ed esterni per rafforzare le relazioni commerciali e creare opportunità di business 
  • Partecipare a team interfunzionali in tutta la rete Deloitte gestendo progetti di alto livello e strategici, coinvolgendo le giuste capacità per sostenere la consegna del progetto e l'implementazione della soluzione.

 
Winning Requirements

  • Laurea specialistica in economia o ingegneria gestionale
  • Esperienza di almeno 5 anni maturata presso aziende o società di consulenza nell’implementazione o gestione di soluzioni SAP all’interno di progetti nazionali ed internazionali
  • Competenze sui almeno uno dei moduli MM,SD,PP,PM,QM,EWM
  • Disponibilità a trasferte in Italia e all’estero
  • Fluente conoscenza della lingua inglese

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme?  Candidati ora! 

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

description_html:
Junior - Categiorie Protette - Data Analyst Milano/Cagliari

Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Data Analytics Audit&Assurance avrai l’occasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe più esperti, sarai responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualità del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realtà leader nel settore.

                                          #YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilità di imparare dai colleghi più Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In particolare, ti occuperai di:

  • Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l’utilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.
  • Sviluppare report e dashboard tramite i principali tool di BI (es. PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud,…).
  • Supportare nell’organizzazione e gestione dei dataset su database relazionali e NoSQL.
  • Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali

Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

                                           #WinningRequirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
  • Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
  • Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
  • Spiccate capacità analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
  • Propensione al lavoro in team
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all’estero
  • Appartenenza alle Categorie Protette Art.1 

                                             #NiceToHave

  • Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.

                                             #LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf

  • Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d’ordine è: crescita
  • L’idea di trasformare un problema in opportunità ti stimola
  • Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
  • Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d’insieme, tenendo sempre a mente l’operatività per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrità e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
  • Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorità possono cambiare quotidianamente
  • Ami lavorare in team

Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

                                    #MakeanImpactThatMatters

title: Junior SAP Basis Consultant @ Thessaloniki
description_html:
Junior SAP BASIS Consultant

What Impact will you make?

#YourOpportunity
Deloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Since 2018, Deloitte has been operating its Competence Center in Thessaloniki with satellites in the cities of Patras, Heraklion, and Ioannina - which are model hubs of expertise, training, and innovation, specializing in cutting-edge exponential technologies, in which graduates and young professionals undergo immersive experiences, continuous learning, gaining practical insights and hands-on training that empower them to navigate the complexities of the digital landscape.
Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team.

#YourServiceLine

Technology & Transformation

Our Technology & Transformation teams empower organizations to navigate the future through technology-driven business transformation. Combining deep industry knowledge with cutting-edge technology, we deliver tailored solutions that drive innovation, enhance efficiency, promote cybersecurity, and foster sustainable growth.

#AboutYourTeam
Inside the Service Line Technology & Transformation, you will be part of the SAP Rise and Architectures capability, this specialized SAP Basis team is a designed to support the delivery of complex SAP implementation projects, such as SAP S/4HANA transformations and its extensions with SAP BTP. It provides expertise in designing, planning, and managing diverse deployment architectures—including on-premise, cloud, and hybrid models—ensuring seamless integration, scalability, and optimization. This capability enables organizations to accelerate their digital transformation journeys by aligning technical architecture with business objectives, mitigating risks, and delivering efficient, flexible, and future-ready SAP solutions.

You will be part of an international project delivery team, with colleagues in Greece as well as other international offices, including Italy. 

You will get the chance to share your experience and knowledge with your colleagues in Thessaloniki and abroad and help realizing our ambition: “make an impact that matters”. 

 #YourResponsibilities
Depending on your previous experience and attitude, in a longer or shorter time, you will progressively be able to and will:
  • Work collaboratively with local and remote team.
  • Analyze requisites and design new target SAP complex architectures.
  • Plan and install new SAP S/4HANA solutions. 
  • Database Administration: Managing SAP databases, including backup and recovery, data migration, and performance tuning for database systems. 
  • System Upgrades and Patch Management: Planning and executing system upgrades, applying patches, and ensuring system compatibility with the latest SAP releases. 
  • SAP System Administration: Managing SAP system landscapes, including configuration, and maintenance of SAP software components. 
  • Performance Monitoring and Tuning: Monitoring system performance, identifying bottlenecks, and implementing tuning measures to optimize system efficiency. 
  • Perform Technical Testing and Verifications. 
  • Ensure the resolution of complex incidents. 
  • Problem management (bug, updates failures) and propose technical solutions. 
  • Manage the technical sustainability and ensure alignment with client requirements. 
  • User and Security Administration: Managing user access, authorizations, and security settings within the SAP environment to ensure data protection and compliance.  

#OurRequirements
The ideal candidate meets the following requirements:
• Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields.
• Basic understanding of operating systems, especially Linux (Red Hat, SUSE) and Windows Server.
• Fundamental networking knowledge, including basic protocols, IP addressing, and firewall concepts.
• Introductory knowledge of databases and basic SQL.
• Programming or scripting skills (e.g., Bash, Python) for automation.
• Strong motivation to learn and develop technical skills through on-the-job training.
• Good communication and teamwork skills.
• Willingness to work under supervision and gradually take on more complex tasks.
• Proficiency in written and spoken English

Soft Skills Important:
• Attention to detail and precision in system administration tasks.
• Collaborative attitude and willingness to learn from senior colleagues.
• Strong interest in IT and SAP technologies with motivation for continuous professional growth.

If you are eager to develop your career in a dynamic environment and grow your expertise in SAP Basis administration, we encourage you to apply.

#WhoWeAreLookingFor
Individuals who have a strong will to expand their knowledge of new technologies, a passion to grow within the company and aspirations for career growth. We are seeking candidates who can manage stress effectively, demonstrate strong determination, and show a high level of commitment At Deloitte we foster a consultative culture because the best decisions are made in collaboration with others. We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact. These are not aspirations, but principles that we all commit to today and every day.

#WhatWeOffer
 At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits:

🏠 Modern hybrid workplace, characterized by flexibility and Smart Working
⚖ Empowered well-being: We provide multiple program offerings to support your well-being needs (flexible working arrangements, extra days of leave, parental allowances)
🌍 Engagement within international large-scale teams and projects, with opportunities to travel for training or client purposes.
📚 Constant opportunities for learning with unlimited access to internal and external learning platforms and sponsored certificates aligned with business needs and technology trends
🚀 Challenging and innovating environment where personal development and growth are encouraged, always with transparency and trust
🏳️‍🌈 Diverse culture and active communities that enable you to bring yourself to work
🎉 Team Building and Corporate Social Responsibility Activities
🏃 A buddy to support you with your onboarding
⚕ Private medical health insurance plan
💳 Ticket restaurant card
🛍️ Exclusive Discounts to several retail providers, restaurants and others
📱 Mobile phone
🍏 Fresh fruits and unlimited coffee everyday at our offices
Please note that all the well-being benefits mentioned above are subject to annual review.

Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Location: Thessaloniki

description_html:
Vuoi intraprendere la Professione di Dottore Commercialista o Avvocato e dedicarti alla consulenza fiscale d’impresa domestica ed internazionale? Lo Studio Tributario e Societario Deloitte è alla ricerca di neolaureati o giovani professionisti con background economico e tributario da inserire nel team Financial Services Industry (FSI) per la sede di Torino.

Avrai la possibilità di collaborare alla consulenza e assistenza relativa a temi di fiscalità diretta domestica e internazionale per clienti che operano nel settore bancario e finanziario.

Fornirai consulenza continuativa in materia di imposte dirette nei confronti di società di capitali, relativa a tematiche di fiscalità nazionale e internazionale (e.g. CFC, Permanent Establishment, ecc.); avrai l’opportunità di occuparti di consulenza in merito al trattamento fiscale di operazioni di natura straordinaria (e.g. fusioni, scissioni, conferimenti, ecc.) e parteciperai ad attività di tax due diligence.

Grazie all’attività consulenziale ed alla formazione continua interna allo Studio (corso di formazione per i neoentrati, meeting di aggiornamento periodici, possibilità di collaborare ad attività pubblicistiche, corsi di inglese, corsi di materie digitali e STEM, etc) avrai modo di sviluppare ottime competenze pratiche e teoriche, il tutto all’interno di una primaria realtà riconosciuta a livello Globale come sinonimo di eccezionale qualità, che mette al centro della propria attività la diversità e l’inclusione delle persone.

About Financial Services Industry (FSI):

Il Team FSI della sede di Torino si occupa sia di tematiche di fiscalità d'impresa generale (ordinaria e straordinaria) sia specialistiche (assistenza in operazioni di M&A, fiscalità Internazionale, tax control framework e digitalizzazione processi fiscali d'impresa). Inoltre, il Team assiste e supporta intermediari finanziari (italiani ed esteri) nell’ambito delle normative relative agli scambi automatici di informazioni ai fini fiscali.

Ti sarà affidato un ruolo proattivo e di crescente responsabilità negli incarichi e progetti in cui sarai coinvolt*, costantemente supportat* all’interno dei Team di lavoro da associate e senior esperti in materia, coordinati da partner Deloitte.

WINNING REQUIREMENTS

Ti sarà affidato un ruolo proattivo e di crescente responsabilità negli incarichi e progetti in cui sarai coinvolt*, costantemente supportat* all’interno dei Team di lavoro da associate e senior esperti in materia, coordinati da partner Deloitte.

Sei il profilo che cerchiamo se hai le seguenti caratteristiche:

• Laureand* in corsi di laurea in Economia (LM-77 LM-56) o Giurisprudenza;
• Neolaureat* in Economia o Giurisprudenza o con minima esperienza maturata in Studi Professionali;
• Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;
• Conoscenza di applicazioni standard (Microsoft Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook);
• Motivazione, determinazione e propensione al team working;
• Predisposizione al problem solving.

Cerchiamo persone motivate, appassionate alle materie tributarie e contabili, che vogliano intraprendere un percorso trasversale e multidisciplinare di crescita professionale che li conduca ad acquisire le competenze tecniche e personali necessarie sia per l’abilitazione e l’esercizio della Professione di Dottore Commercialista o Avvocato sia per un soddisfacente percorso di carriera nell'ambito della consulenza fiscale di nuova generazione.

ABOUT STUDIO TRIBUTARIO E SOCIETARIO

Lo Studio Tributario e Societario, Società tra Professionisti dedicata alla consulenza ed assistenza fiscale ad imprese e gruppi italiani ed internazionali, facente parte del network Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu, è presente in Italia con sedi a Milano, Roma, Firenze, Torino, Genova, Bologna, Padova, Napoli e Catania. Lo Studio offre consulenza ed assistenza fiscale e tributaria nei diversi settori di specializzazione con scrupolosa attenzione agli aspetti tecnici, forte impegno verso la qualità e continuo riferimento alle esigenze del cliente.

MAKE AN IMPACT THAT MATTERS

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione. #LI-Hybrid

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

description_html:
YOUR ROLE

  La Service Line Global Employer Services (GES) dello Studio Tributario e Societario Deloitte è alla ricerca di una figura con esperienza da inserire come Global Mobility - Immigration HNWI Consultant presso la sede di Milano.

La risorsa si occuperà di gestire le pratiche immigrative relative al trasferimento in Italia e/o all'estero per clienti privati ​​e High Net Worth Individuals (HNWI) e di fornire la relativa consulenza in materia, ed in particolare:

 * Acquisizione delle informazioni necessarie per la richiesta e l'ottenimento della documentazione propedeutica all'ingresso e al soggiorno in Italia per motivi di lavoro o per altri motivi (Nulla Osta, Visto, Permesso di Soggiorno);

 * Comunicazione delle procedure atte alla realizzazione di quanto sopra in base alle normative vigenti in materia di immigrazione;

 * Redazione e compilazione della relativa modulistica;

 * Assistenza diretta al cliente nella gestione delle pratiche amministrative correlate alla tipologia di servizio (assistenza e supporto presso gli uffici pubblici).

WINNING REQUIREMENTS

 * Esperienza di 1, massimo 2 anni nel medesimo ruolo;

 * Fluente conoscenza della lingua inglese, parlata e scritta;

 * Capacità di lavorare in team

 Completano il profilo: ottime capacità relazionali, buona organizzazione del lavoro e la predisposizione al problem solving.

description_html:
Experienced - Java Developer - NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando una figura da Consultant con massimo 1-2 anni di esperienza da inserire nel team di Software Engineering & Modernization nella sede di Bari e che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid. 

Your Role 

Il Developer è un professionista IT responsabile dello sviluppo e dell'evoluzione di applicazioni enterprise, principalmente basate su tecnologie Java.  

Tra cui:
  • Progettare e implementare soluzioni software su Java e Spring Boot; 
  • Contribuire allo sviluppo frontend, principalmente in React e/o React Native

Winning Requirements
  • Laurea triennale/specialistica in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica o Ingegneria Elettronica
  • Competenze sviluppo Java (preferred conoscenza framework Spring)
  • Competenze sviluppo FE (conoscenza di almeno uno tra i framework Angular, Vue o React)
  • Conoscenza DB relazionali

To Make An Impact That Matters 

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone. 

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal. 

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo. 

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che - in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti - hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

title: TAX - The Deloitte ACCA Programme - 2025 Intake
description_html:
The Deloitte ACCA Programme

Your Story

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.


Your Journey with Us

We are looking for ambitious individuals who are eager to start their ACCA journey. Here at Deloitte, we offer continuous guidance and support during your studies, as well as providing valuable work experience. You will be contributing to team productivity and working to help solve complex business issues our clients face.

As an ACCA student working with Deloitte, you will get the opportunity to work with a variety of clients, alongside qualified accountants who will coach you throughout your journey.


What’s in it for you?

  • Full time employment with Deloitte with the option to work reduced hours.
  • The option to study full time during the initial period of the programme;
  • Fully subsidized study courses, material and examinations.
  • Flexibility to choose your own learning provider to suit your learning style
  • Salary increments with every successful examination pass.
  • Study leave and continuous support during your studies
  • Opportunity for overseas experiences once you qualify.
  • Support from mentors, buddies and a dedicated learning team
  • Appraisals to help you stay on track and plan your future.
  • Access to thousands of e-learning courses on our platform

Most importantly, with our dedicated team of professionals ready to guide you throughout your journey, you will have the opportunity to graduate within 3 years.

Feel free to visit the Deloitte ACCA Programme page for more information about this programme.


Let’ s Talk About You

You have at least a minimum of two Advanced level certificates in any subject (with grades A, B or C) and a minimum of three Ordinary level certificates, which must include Mathematics and English. You are also eligible to apply if you possess a Bachelors’ degree (preferably 2:1 or higher) or Advanced Diploma in any related field.

You're a result driven individual who continuously seeks feedback to enhance quality and performance. You’re agile and adaptable but work with precision to ensure we deliver outstanding experiences. You are a strategic thinker and problem solver who will quickly develop close working relationships with others supporting wider processes and policies.

Those who have already started their ACCA journey, are also welcome to apply.


Why Deloitte?

World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.

Our local Tax function comprises of approximately 120 professionals. In Tax, you will get the opportunity to provide clients with the support and advice they need to make key decisions on an international scale. We bring together a mix of commercial, industry and technical tax and regulatory knowledge, creative thinking and innovative technology, to help solve some of the most complex business issues our clients face. In this an ever-more high-profile area, you’ll have the chance to understand how business, and your particular clients, really work.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Premium membership for corporate discounts in restaurants, retail, gyms and more.
  • Health Insurance cover for yourself and dependents. 
  • Sponsored mental health support sessions through leading mental health services.
  • Weekly get-togethers.
  • Deloitte Communities to bring our people together and encourage work/life balance, social life and common interests.
  • Hybrid working flexibility subject to business requirements.
  • Digital learning, mentoring and regular performance snapshots. 
  • Renowned training programme with Deloitte University.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

title: Experienced – ServiceNow & Emerging Technologies
description_html:
Experienced – ServiceNow & Emerging Technologies 


Stiamo cercando una figura consultant/senior consultant da inserire nel team ServiceNow & Emerging Technologies di Deloitte nella sede di Milano o Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business ServiceNow & Emerging Technologies si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

Sarai coinvolto nel supporto delle attività di assistenza al CEO e il Top Management dell’azienda nel migliorare la profittabilità e raggiungere l’eccellenza operativa del business model.

 

Your Role


La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:


  • Individuare, selezionare ed eventualmente customizzare gli strumenti più utili per la raccolta ed analisi di dati e l’elaborazione di soluzioni a supporto degli obiettivi del cliente;
  • Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni del cliente, individuando le metodologie e gli approcci più adatti per la loro ottimale soddisfazione e supportando il Manager di progetto nella loro trasformazione in priorità progettuali ed action-plan;
  • Garantire la produzione di soluzioni solide e corredate da dati finanziari utilizzando strumenti e risorse messe a disposizione e coordinando persone più Junior.


Winning Requirements


  • Esperienza di almeno 2- 4 anni in società multinazionali di consulenza focalizzate sulla Technology Strategy ed Innovation;
  • Laurea Specialistica in materie STEM;
  • Spiccato interesse e conoscenza delle principali tematiche legate al mondo ICT ed in particolare a ServiceNow e nelle principali metodologie di Enterprise Architecture;
  • Ottimo livello di inglese.

title: Manager - Software Asset Management - NextHub
description_html:
Manager - Software Asset Management - NextHub



Stiamo cercando una figura Manager da inserire nel team Software Asset Management di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.
Il business si occupa di supportare le aziende nella valutazione e nella gestione dei rischi associati ai prodotti / servizi IT, guidandole verso un’ottimizzazione dei costi associati agli asset IT, al miglioramento della governance e dei processi IT.
I servizi di interesse riguardano quelli afferenti alle tematiche di Vendor Management ovvero valutazione e gestione dei rischi associati alle terze parti (outsourcers, licenziatari, fornitori).




Your Role



La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:

  • Gestione di un team di risorse: dalla formazione allo sviluppo del professionista, valutandolo e sostenendolo nella crescita, assicurando un ambiente di lavoro positivo e produttivo 
  • Coordinamento verso il resto del management e top management di linea 
  • Supporto nella delivery progettuale con attenzione alla qualità e tempistiche, con la responsabilità nella verifica i dati raccolti e le analisi svolte 
  • Supporto nella pianificazione e ottimizzazione: sviluppo e implementazione di piani operativi, anche a medio e lungo termine 
  • Valorizzare il contributo delle risorse più Junior e contribuire alla loro crescita professionale 
  • Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del management 
  • Supportare il team di progetto nel predisporre e monitorare il piano di progetto e dello stato avanzamento delle attività, in coordinamento con i vari interlocutori e nel reporting agli stakeholder di riferimento. 
  • Leadership: guidare e motivare un team, di delegare efficacemente e di prendere decisioni opportune nelle limitate tempistiche 



Winning Requirements


  • Pregressa esperienza lavorativa in ambito di gestione delle persone maturata attraverso precedenti lavori  
  • Conoscenza di strumenti delle basi IT infrastrutturali on-premise e Cloud e dei principali strumenti di IT Software & asset Management (Microsoft SCCM, Intune, Ansible, Flexera, Snow, Apptio,  ServiceNow).  
  • Saper gestire le attività principali quali: maturità e/o valutazione nella gestione del rischio, comprendere i concetti di architettura informatica 
  • Conoscenza delle politiche di licensing dei principali software vendor come Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, SAP, VMware, Red Hat, ecc. 
  • Laurea in Ingegneria gestionale, Informatica, STEM o Business Management 
  • Gradita la conoscenza della lingua inglese

title: Experienced - Customer Strategy - NextHub Bari
description_html:
Experienced - Customer & Commercial Strategy - NextHub Bari


Stiamo cercando una figura Consultant da inserire nel team di Customer & Commercial Strategy NextHub di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Nel team Customer & Commercial Strategy di NextHub ogni giorno ci impegniamo nel definire la strategia ed il percorso di trasformazione digitale per i nostri Clienti operanti nel settore Corporate, abilitando nuovi modelli operativi sempre più incentrati sulla valorizzazione di un’Experience distintiva per la customer base. 
Supportiamo i nostri Clienti nel disegnare e potenziare la Customer Experience dei clienti finali, trasformando i dati e l’ascolto del cliente in insight di valore. 


Your Role

La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:

  • Digital Strategy Definition, Roadmapping & Cost case e nell’identificazione della lista di interventi, con previsione delle rispettive priorità e dell’impatto economico, da mettere a terra per la realizzazione della trasformazione digitale in risposta ai need identificati
  • Competenze di Diagnostic, Analisi e Reingegnerizzazione dei processi mediante l’assessment dell’attuale stato di digitalizzazione dei clienti e la definizione del modello to-be con la raccolta dei requisiti di business e tecnologici necessari all’implementazione dei nuovi processi target alla base della trasformazione
  • Program & Project Management di iniziative complesse di Digital Transformation finalizzati alla governance end-to-end del percorso di trasformazione, gestendo la relazione con il cliente, coordinando tutti i tavoli di lavoro e i vari stakeholder coinvolti nell’iniziativa - interni ad esterni a Deloitte
  • Design, Build & Deploy di strategie e soluzioni digitali al servizio della Customer Experience a 360°
  • Collaborare a iniziative di business development attraverso la preparazione di gare e POV aventi l’obiettivo di abilitare nuove opportunità progettuali su clienti nuovi o già esistenti



Winning Requirements

  • Esperienza di almeno 2-4 anni in società di consulenza, system integration oppure in ambito aziendale su progetti di trasformazione digitale nel settore dei Financial Services;
  • Esperienza su progetti in ambito tecnologico come PMO / PM nella gestione di iniziative progettuali complesse;
  • Esperienza nel coordinamento di piani e tavoli di lavoro paralleli dimostrando capacità ed efficienza nell’esecuzione delle attività progettuali del team e nel monitoraggio degli avanzamenti progettuali;
  • Ottime capacità di comunicazione, relazione, organizzative all’interno di un team.

Saranno considerati come plus:

  • Esperienza nell’ambito dei settori sopra citati per la risposta a bandi di gara o la definizione di nuove proposte commerciali
  • Progettualità che prevedono l’interazione con il Top Management dei clienti (es. preparazione Steering Committee, etc.)

title: Software Engineers - Experienced .Net Developers
description_html:
Experienced .Net Developer


What Impact will you make?


#YourOpportunity

Deloitte is proud to be named the no. 1 consulting service provider in the world by Gartner and the most valuable and strongest commercial services brand in the world by Brand Finance.

We are delivering business advisory and technology-enabled business transformations across the globe, always with a focus to our vision: to make an impact that matters. Within Deloitte, the Engineering, AI & Data team focuses on delivering trusted high-end technology advisory services.

Under this framework, we are currently looking for an enthusiastic experienced .Net Developer to become part of our dynamic Technology & Transformation team in our offices in Athens. In this role, you’ll work within a team to help clients transform their technology platforms and business operations. Partnering with some of the world’s largest organizations, you’ll help COO’s, CFO’s, CIO’s and their teams realize their ambitions – from improving financial performance, to accelerating speed to market and delivering continuous innovation.

#YourRole

As an experienced .Net Developer,  you will contribute to the evolution of a large-scale integration and orchestration platform hosted on Azure. Your responsibilities will include major refactoring, implementing new features, and driving technical improvements. You will:

  • Design and implement robust .Net solutions for orchestration, decomposition and integration processes;
  • Refactor legacy components to improve performance, scalability, and maintainability;
  • Develop asynchronous workflows and microservices to enhance system resilience;
  • Collaborate with architects and senior engineers to define technical strategies and best practices;
  • Optimize cloud - hosted environments (Azure) for reliability and cost efficiency;
  • Ensure compliance with security, data integrity , and performance standards;
  • Mentor junior team members and contribute to knowledge sharing.


#WinningRequirements

To qualify for the role you must have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; 
  • 3-5 years of experience working with .NET (C#) or any other OOP language, coupled with the willingness to expand your technical repertoire;
  • Solid understanding of asynchronous programming and microservices architecture;
  • Hands - on experience with Azure services (App Services, Functions, Storage, etc.);
  • Strong knowledge of integration patterns (APIs, ESB, messaging queues);
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices;
  • Excellent problem - solving and communication skills.
Nice to have:
  • Experience with large - scale enterprise systems;
  • Knowledge of performance tuning and scalability strategies;
  • Experience with CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps preferred).

#AboutTechnology&Transformation 

Six core competency areas make up our Technology & Transformation service line:

  • Cyber;
  • Engineering, AI & Data;
  • Enterprise, Technology & Performance;
  • Finance Transformation
  • Deloitte Digital;
  • Human Capital.

We exist to solve complex problems

Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Technology & Transformation team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.

We are committed to collaboration

Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge.  In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.

We create long-term, sustainable impact  

We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.


WHY DELOITTE

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

ABOUT DELOITTE

Our services

Deloitte operates in Greece since 1975, as a member of one of the world’s largest professional services networks, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu. With offices in Athens, Thessaloniki, Heraklion, Patras and Ioannina, Deloitte Greece employs more than 2,900 professionals.

After 50 years of successful and dynamic presence in the Greek market, we bring an unmatched breadth and depth of expertise across audit and assurance, technology & transformation, tax & legal and strategy, risk & transactions advisory services. Operating in a multidisciplinary model enables us to draw from a pool of world-class talent, identifying the ideal skillset for each project, and to collaborate across businesses, to solve the toughest, most challenging issues of our clients. It is with them that we have built a trusted relationship, by delivering innovative solutions and utilizing state-of-the-art tools and technologies across all industries- Consumer Products, Energy Resources & Industrials, Financial Services, Life Sciences & Health Care, Government & Public Services, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.

Our Purpose

Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.

Our values

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism.

We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.

Our talent experience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the center of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.


Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.
